Policy name.
open-authoption
Enable/disable open authentication for this policy.
"disable"Disable open authentication.
"enable"Enable open authentication.
policy-typeoption
Policy type.
"802.1X"802.1X security policy.
radius-timeout-overwriteoption
Enable to override the global RADIUS session timeout.
"disable"Override the global RADIUS session timeout.
"enable"Use the global RADIUS session timeout.
security-modeoption
Port or MAC based 802.1X security mode.
"802.1X"802.1X port based authentication.
"802.1X-mac-based"802.1X MAC based authentication.
user-groupdatasource, refer to user group
Name of user-group to assign to this MAC Authentication Bypass (MAB) policy.

 

switch-controller/switch-group (table)

Configure FortiSwitch switch groups.

Require device/vdom scope member.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/switch-controller/switch-group
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/switch-controller/switch-group/<switch-group_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
descriptionstring
Optional switch group description.
fortilinkdatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
FortiLink interface to which switch group members belong.
membersdatasource, refer to switch-controller managed-switch, or fsp managed-switch
FortiSwitch members belonging to this switch group.
namestring, master key
Switch group name.
scope memberscope object, refer to device object

 

switch-controller/switch-interface-tag (table)

Configure switch object tags.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/switch-controller/switch-interface-tag
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/switch-controller/switch-interface-tag/<switch-interface-tag_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
namestring, master key
Tag name.

 

switch-controller/traffic-policy (table)

Configure FortiSwitch traffic policy.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/switch-controller/traffic-policy
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/switch-controller/traffic-policy/<traffic-policy_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
cos-queueunsigned int32
COS queue(0 - 7), or unset to disable.
descriptionstring
Description of the traffic policy.
guaranteed-bandwidthunsigned int32
Guaranteed bandwidth in kbps (max value = 524287000).
guaranteed-burstunsigned int32
Guaranteed burst size in bytes (max value = 4294967295).
idunsigned int32
FSW Policer id
maximum-burstunsigned int32
Maximum burst size in bytes (max value = 4294967295).
namestring, master key
Traffic policy name.
policer-statusoption
Enable/disable policer config on the traffic policy.
"disable"Disable policer config on the traffic policy.
"enable"Enable policer config on the traffic policy.
typeoption
"ingress"
"egress"

 

switch-controller/vlan-policy (table)

Configure VLAN policy to be applied on the managed FortiSwitch ports through dynamic-port-policy.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/switch-controller/vlan-policy
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/switch-controller/vlan-policy/<vlan-policy_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
allowed-vlansdatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan
Allowed VLANs to be applied when using this VLAN policy.
allowed-vlans-alloption
Enable/disable all defined VLANs when using this VLAN policy.
"disable"Disable all defined VLANs.
"enable"Enable all defined VLANs.
descriptionstring
Description for the VLAN policy.
discard-modeoption
Discard mode to be applied when using this VLAN policy.
"none"Discard disabled.
"all-untagged"Discard all frames that are untagged.
"all-tagged"Discard all frames that are tagged.
namestring, master key
VLAN policy name.
untagged-vlansdatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan
Untagged VLANs to be applied when using this VLAN policy.
vlandatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan (maximum 1)
Native VLAN to be applied when using this VLAN policy.

 

wireless-controller/access-control-list (table)

Configure WiFi bridge access control list.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/access-control-list
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/access-control-list/<access-control-list_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Description.
layer3-ipv4-rulestable
layer3-ipv6-rulestable
namestring, master key
AP access control list name.

 

wireless-controller/access-control-list/layer3-ipv4-rules (table)

AP ACL layer3 ipv4 rule list.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, move, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/access-control-list/<access-control-list_name>/layer3-ipv4-rules
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/access-control-list/<access-control-list_name>/layer3-ipv4-rules/<layer3-ipv4-rules_rule-id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
actionoption
Policy action (allow | deny).
"allow"Allows traffic matching the policy.
"deny"Blocks traffic matching the policy.
commentstring
Description.
dstaddrstring
Destination IP address (any | local-LAN | IPv4 address[/<network mask | mask length>], default = any).
dstportunsigned int32
Destination port (0 - 65535, default = 0, meaning any).
protocolunsigned int32
Protocol type as defined by IANA (0 - 255, default = 255, meaning any).
rule-idunsigned int32, master key
Rule ID (1 - 65535).
srcaddrstring
Source IP address (any | local-LAN | IPv4 address[/<network mask | mask length>], default = any).
srcportunsigned int32
Source port (0 - 65535, default = 0, meaning any).

 

wireless-controller/access-control-list/layer3-ipv6-rules (table)

AP ACL layer3 ipv6 rule list.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, move, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/access-control-list/<access-control-list_name>/layer3-ipv6-rules
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/access-control-list/<access-control-list_name>/layer3-ipv6-rules/<layer3-ipv6-rules_rule-id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
actionoption
Policy action (allow | deny).
"allow"Allows traffic matching the policy.
"deny"Blocks traffic matching the policy.
commentstring
Description.
dstaddrstring
Destination IPv6 address (any | local-LAN | IPv6 address[/prefix length]), default = any.
dstportunsigned int32
Destination port (0 - 65535, default = 0, meaning any).
protocolunsigned int32
Protocol type as defined by IANA (0 - 255, default = 255, meaning any).
rule-idunsigned int32, master key
Rule ID (1 - 65535).
srcaddrstring
Source IPv6 address (any | local-LAN | IPv6 address[/prefix length]), default = any.
srcportunsigned int32
Source port (0 - 65535, default = 0, meaning any).

 

wireless-controller/apcfg-profile (table)

Configure AP local configuration profiles.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/apcfg-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/apcfg-profile/<apcfg-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
ac-ipIPv4 address
IP address of the validation controller that AP must be able to join after applying AP local configuration.
ac-portunsigned int32
Port of the validation controller that AP must be able to join after applying AP local configuration (1024 - 49150, default = 5246).
ac-timerunsigned int32
Maximum waiting time for the AP to join the validation controller after applying AP local configuration (3 - 30 min, default = 10).
ac-typeoption
Validation controller type (default = default).
"default"This controller is the one and only controller that the AP could join after applying AP local configuration.
"specify"Specified controller is the one and only controller that the AP could join after applying AP local configuration.
"apcfg"Any controller defined by AP local configuration after applying AP local configuration.
ap-familyoption
FortiAP family type (default = fap).
"fap"FortiAP Family.
"fap-u"FortiAP-U Family.
"fap-c"FortiAP-C Family.
command-listtable
commentstring
Comment.
namestring, master key
AP local configuration profile name.

 

wireless-controller/apcfg-profile/command-list (table)

AP local configuration command list.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, move, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/apcfg-profile/<apcfg-profile_name>/command-list
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/apcfg-profile/<apcfg-profile_name>/command-list/<command-list_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
idunsigned int32, master key
Command ID.
namestring
AP local configuration command name.
passwd-valuepassword
AP local configuration command password value.
typeoption
The command type (default = non-password).
"non-password"Non-password command.
"password"Password command.
valuestring
AP local configuration command value.

 

wireless-controller/arrp-profile (table)

Configure WiFi Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (ARRP) profiles.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/arrp-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/arrp-profile/<arrp-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Comment.
darrp-optimizeunsigned int32
Time for running Dynamic Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) optimizations (0 - 86400 sec, default = 86400, 0 = disable).
darrp-optimize-schedulesdatasource, refer to firewall schedule group, firewall schedule onetime, or firewall schedule recurring
Firewall schedules for DARRP running time. DARRP will run periodically based on darrp-optimize within the schedules. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
include-dfs-channeloption
Enable/disable use of DFS channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 (default = disable).
"disable"Exclude DFS channel in darrp channel selection phase 1.
"enable"Include DFS channel in darrp channel selection phase 1.
include-weather-channeloption
Enable/disable use of weather channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 (default = disable).
"disable"Exclude weather channel in darrp channel selection phase 1.
"enable"Include weather channel in darrp channel selection phase 1.
monitor-periodunsigned int32
Period in seconds to measure average transmit retries and receive errors (default = 300).
namestring, master key
WiFi ARRP profile name.
override-darrp-optimizeoption
Enable to override setting darrp-optimize and darrp-optimize-schedules (default = disable).
"disable"Use setting darrp-optimize and darrp-optimize-schedules.
"enable"Override setting darrp-optimize and darrp-optimize-schedules.
selection-periodunsigned int32
Period in seconds to measure average channel load, noise floor, spectral RSSI (default = 3600).
threshold-apunsigned int32
Threshold to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to surrounding APs (0 - 500, default = 250).
threshold-channel-loadunsigned int32
Threshold in percentage to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to channel load (0 - 100, default = 60).
threshold-noise-floorstring
Threshold in dBm to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to noise floor (-95 to -20, default = -85).
threshold-rx-errorsunsigned int32
Threshold in percentage for receive errors to trigger channel reselection in DARRP monitor stage (0 - 100, default = 50).
threshold-spectral-rssistring
Threshold in dBm to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to spectral RSSI (-95 to -20, default = -65).
threshold-tx-retriesunsigned int32
Threshold in percentage for transmit retries to trigger channel reselection in DARRP monitor stage (0 - 1000, default = 300).
weight-channel-loadunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for channel load (0 - 2000, default = 20).
weight-dfs-channelunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for DFS channel (0 - 2000, default = 500).
weight-managed-apunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for managed APs (0 - 2000, default = 50).
weight-noise-floorunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for noise floor (0 - 2000, default = 40).
weight-rogue-apunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for rogue APs (0 - 2000, default = 10).
weight-spectral-rssiunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for spectral RSSI (0 - 2000, default = 40).
weight-weather-channelunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for weather channel (0 - 2000, default = 1000).

 

wireless-controller/ble-profile (table)

Configure Bluetooth Low Energy profile.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/ble-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/ble-profile/<ble-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
advertisingflags
Advertising type.
"ibeacon"iBeacon advertising.
"eddystone-uid"Eddystone UID advertising.
"eddystone-url"Eddystone URL advertising.
beacon-intervalunsigned int32
Beacon interval (default = 100 msec).
ble-scanningoption
Enable/disable Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) scanning.
"disable"Disable BLE scanning.
"enable"Enable BLE scanning.
commentstring
Comment.
eddystone-instancestring
Eddystone instance ID.
eddystone-namespacestring
Eddystone namespace ID.
eddystone-urlstring
Eddystone URL.
eddystone-url-encode-hexstring
Eddystone encoded URL hexadecimal string
ibeacon-uuidstring
Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).
major-idunsigned int32
Major ID.
minor-idunsigned int32
Minor ID.
namestring, master key
Bluetooth Low Energy profile name.
txpoweroption
Transmit power level (default = 0).
"0"Transmit power level 0 (-21 dBm)
"1"Transmit power level 1 (-18 dBm)
"2"Transmit power level 2 (-15 dBm)
"3"Transmit power level 3 (-12 dBm)
"4"Transmit power level 4 (-9 dBm)
"5"Transmit power level 5 (-6 dBm)
"6"Transmit power level 6 (-3 dBm)
"7"Transmit power level 7 (0 dBm)
"8"Transmit power level 8 (1 dBm)
"9"Transmit power level 9 (2 dBm)
"10"Transmit power level 10 (3 dBm)
"11"Transmit power level 11 (4 dBm)
"12"Transmit power level 12 (5 dBm)

 

wireless-controller/bonjour-profile (table)

Configure Bonjour profiles. Bonjour is Apple's zero configuration networking protocol. Bonjour profiles allow APs and FortiAPs to connnect to networks using Bonjour.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/bonjour-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/bonjour-profile/<bonjour-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Comment.
namestring, master key
Bonjour profile name.
policy-listtable

 

wireless-controller/bonjour-profile/policy-list (table)

Bonjour policy list.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, move, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/bonjour-profile/<bonjour-profile_name>/policy-list
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/bonjour-profile/<bonjour-profile_name>/policy-list/<policy-list_policy-id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
descriptionstring
Description.
from-vlanstring
VLAN ID from which the Bonjour service is advertised (0 - 4094, default = 0).
policy-idunsigned int32, master key
Policy ID.
servicesflags
Bonjour services for the VLAN connecting to the Bonjour network.
"airplay"AirPlay.
"afp"AFP (Apple File Sharing).
"bit-torrent"BitTorrent.
"ftp"FTP.
"ichat"iChat.
"itunes"iTunes.
"printers"Printers.
"samba"Samba.
"scanners"Scanners.
"ssh"SSH.
"chromecast"ChromeCast.
"all"All services.
to-vlanstring
VLAN ID to which the Bonjour service is made available (0 - 4094, default = all).

Attribute ListDescriptions
ipv4-address-typeoption
IPv4 address type.
"not-available"Address type not available.
"not-known"Availability of the address type is not known.
"public"Public IPv4 address available.
"port-restricted"Port-restricted IPv4 address available.
"single-NATed-private"Single NATed private IPv4 address available.
"double-NATed-private"Double NATed private IPv4 address available.
"port-restricted-and-single-NATed"Port-restricted IPv4 address and single NATed IPv4 address available.
"port-restricted-and-double-NATed"Port-restricted IPv4 address and double NATed IPv4 address available.

IPv6 address type.
"not-available"Address type not available.
"available"Address type available.
"not-known"Availability of the address type not known.

encodingoption

"enable"Enable format in accordance with IETF RFC 4282.
nai-realmstring
Configure NAI realms (delimited by a semi-colon character).

wireless-controller/hotspot20/anqp-venue-name/value-list (table)

Name list.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Attribute ListDescriptions
esp-portoption
Set ESP port service (used by IPsec VPNs) status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
ftp-portoption
Set FTP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
http-portoption
Set HTTP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
icmp-portoption
Set ICMP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
ikev2-portoption
Set IKEv2 port service for IPsec VPN status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
ikev2-xx-portoption
Set UDP port 4500 (which may be used by IKEv2 for IPsec VPN) service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
namestring, master key
Connection capability name.
pptp-vpn-portoption
Set Point to Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP) VPN port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
ssh-portoption
Set SSH port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
tls-portoption
Set TLS VPN (HTTPS) port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
voip-tcp-portoption
Set VoIP TCP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
voip-udp-portoption
Set VoIP UDP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.

Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Comment.
concurrent-client-limit-typeoption
MPSK client limit type options.
"default"Using the value in profile configuration.
"unlimited"Unlimited.
"specified"Specified value.
concurrent-clientsunsigned int32
Number of clients that can connect using this pre-shared key (1 - 65535, default is 256).
macmac address
MAC address.
mpsk-schedulesdatasource, refer to firewall schedule group, firewall schedule onetime, or firewall schedule recurring (maximum 16)
Firewall schedule for MPSK passphrase. The passphrase will be effective only when at least one schedule is valid.
namestring, master key
Pre-shared key name.
passphrasepassword
WPA Pre-shared key.
pmkpassword
WPA PMK.

commentstring
Comment.

Name.
onboarding-vlandatasource, refer to system interface, or dynamic interface (maximum 1)

wireless-controller/qos-profile (table)

Configure WiFi quality of service (QoS) profiles.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/qos-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/qos-profile/<qos-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
bandwidth-admission-controloption
Enable/disable WMM bandwidth admission control.
"disable"Disable WMM bandwidth admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM bandwidth admission control.
bandwidth-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum bandwidth capacity allowed (1 - 600000 Kbps, default = 2000).
burstoption
Enable/disable client rate burst.
"disable"Disable client rate burst.
"enable"Enable client rate burst.
call-admission-controloption
Enable/disable WMM call admission control.
"disable"Disable WMM call admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM call admission control.
call-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum number of Voice over WLAN (VoWLAN) phones allowed (0 - 60, default = 10).
commentstring
Comment.
downlinkunsigned int32
Maximum downlink bandwidth for Virtual Access Points (VAPs) (0 - 2097152 Kbps, default = 0, 0 means no limit).
downlink-staunsigned int32
Maximum downlink bandwidth for clients (0 - 2097152 Kbps, default = 0, 0 means no limit).
dscp-wmm-beint array
DSCP mapping for best effort access (default = 0 24).
dscp-wmm-bkint array
DSCP mapping for background access (default = 8 16).
dscp-wmm-mappingoption
Enable/disable Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) mapping.
"disable"Disable Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) mapping.
"enable"Enable Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) mapping.
dscp-wmm-viint array
DSCP mapping for video access (default = 32 40).
dscp-wmm-voint array
DSCP mapping for voice access (default = 48 56).
namestring, master key
WiFi QoS profile name.
uplinkunsigned int32
Maximum uplink bandwidth for Virtual Access Points (VAPs) (0 - 2097152 Kbps, default = 0, 0 means no limit).
uplink-staunsigned int32
Maximum uplink bandwidth for clients (0 - 2097152 Kbps, default = 0, 0 means no limit).
wmmoption
Enable/disable WiFi multi-media (WMM) control.
"disable"Disable WiFi multi-media (WMM) control.
"enable"Enable WiFi multi-media (WMM) control.
wmm-be-dscpunsigned int32
DSCP marking for best effort access (default = 0).
wmm-bk-dscpunsigned int32
DSCP marking for background access (default = 8).
wmm-dscp-markingoption
Enable/disable WMM Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) marking.
"disable"Disable WMM Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) marking.
"enable"Enable WMM Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) marking.
wmm-uapsdoption
Enable/disable WMM Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery (U-APSD) power save mode.
"disable"Disable WMM Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery (U-APSD) power save mode.
"enable"Enable WMM Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery (U-APSD) power save mode.
wmm-vi-dscpunsigned int32
DSCP marking for video access (default = 32).
wmm-vo-dscpunsigned int32
DSCP marking for voice access (default = 48).

wireless-controller/syslog-profile (table)

Configure Wireless Termination Points (WTP) system log server profile.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/syslog-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/syslog-profile/<syslog-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Comment.
log-leveloption
Lowest level of log messages that FortiAP units send to this server (default = information).
"emergency"Level 0
"alert"Level 1
"critical"Level 2
"error"Level 3
"warning"Level 4
"notification"Level 5
"information"Level 6
"debugging"Level 7
namestring, master key
WTP system log server profile name.
server-addr-typeoption
Syslog server address type (default = ip).
"fqdn"Fully Qualified Domain Name address.
"ip"IPv4 address.
server-fqdnstring
FQDN of syslog server that FortiAP units send log messages to.
server-ipIPv4 address
IP address of syslog server that FortiAP units send log messages to.
server-portunsigned int32
Port number of syslog server that FortiAP units send log messages to (default = 514).
server-statusoption
Enable/disable FortiAP units to send log messages to a syslog server (default = enable).
"disable"Disable syslog server.
"enable"Enable syslog server.

wireless-controller/vap (table)

Configure Virtual Access Points (VAPs).

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/vap

Attribute ListDescriptions
_centmgmtoption
"disable"
"enable"[Default value]
_dhcp_svr_iddatasource, refer to sys_dhcp_svr id (maximum 1)
_intf_allowaccessflags, support meta variable
"https"
"ping"
"ssh"
"snmp"
"http"
"telnet"
"fgfm"
"radius-acct"
"probe-response"
"dnp"
"ftm"
"fabric"
"speed-test"

"disable"[Default value]

_intf_device-netscanoption
"disable"[Default value]

_intf_listen-forticlient-connectionoption
"disable"[Default value]

_is_factory_settingoption
"disable"[Default value]
"enable"
"ext"
access-control-listdatasource, refer to wireless-controller access-control-list (maximum 1)
Profile name for access-control-list.
additional-akmsflags
Additional AKMs.
"akm6"Use AKM suite employing PSK_SHA256.
address-groupdatasource, refer to wireless-controller addrgrp, or firewall addrgrp (maximum 1)
Address group ID.
aliasstring
Alias.
antivirus-profiledatasource, refer to antivirus profile (maximum 1)
AntiVirus profile name.
application-listdatasource, refer to application list (maximum 1)
Application control list name.
atf-weightunsigned int32
Airtime weight in percentage (default = 20).
authoption
Authentication protocol.
"radius"Use a RADIUS server to authenticate clients.
"usergroup"Use a firewall usergroup to authenticate clients.
"psk"Use a single Pre-shard Key (PSK) to authenticate all users.
auth-certdatasource, refer to vpn certificate local, or dynamic certificate local (maximum 1)
HTTPS server certificate.
auth-portal-addrstring
Address of captive portal.
beacon-advertisingflags
Fortinet beacon advertising IE data (default = empty).
"name"AP name.
"model"AP model abbreviation.
"serial-number"AP serial number.
broadcast-ssidoption
Enable/disable broadcasting the SSID (default = enable).
"disable"Disable broadcasting the SSID.
"enable"Enable broadcasting the SSID.
broadcast-suppressionflags
Optional suppression of broadcast messages. For example, you can keep DHCP messages, ARP broadcasts, and so on off of the wireless network.
"netbios-ns"Suppress NetBIOS name services packets with UDP port 137.
"netbios-ds"Suppress NetBIOS datagram services packets with UDP port 138.
"dhcp-up"Suppress broadcast uplink DHCP messages.
"dhcp-down"Suppress broadcast downlink DHCP messages.
"arp-known"Suppress broadcast ARP for known wireless clients.
"arp-unknown"Suppress broadcast ARP for unknown wireless clients.
"arp-reply"Suppress broadcast ARP reply from wireless clients.
"ipv6"Suppress IPv6 packets.
"dhcp-starvation"Suppress broadcast DHCP starvation req messages.
"arp-poison"Suppress ARP poison messages from wireless clients.
"all-other-mc"Suppress all other multicast messages.
"all-other-bc"Suppress all other broadcast messages.
"arp-proxy"Reply ARP requests for wireless clients as a proxy.
"dhcp-ucast"Convert downlink broadcast DHCP messages to unicast messages.
bss-color-partialoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax partial BSS color (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax partial BSS color.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax partial BSS color.
bstm-disassociation-imminentoption
Enable/disable forcing of disassociation after the BSTM request timer has been reached (default = enable).
"disable"Disable BSTM disassociation imminent.
"enable"Enable BSTM disassociation imminent.
bstm-load-balancing-disassoc-timerunsigned int32
Time interval for client to voluntarily leave AP before forcing a disassociation due to AP load-balancing (0 to 30, default = 10).
bstm-rssi-disassoc-timerunsigned int32
Time interval for client to voluntarily leave AP before forcing a disassociation due to low RSSI (0 to 2000, default = 200).
captive-portal-ac-namestring
Local-bridging captive portal ac-name.
captive-portal-auth-timeoutunsigned int32
Hard timeout - AP will always clear the session after timeout regardless of traffic (0 - 864000 sec, default = 0).
dhcp-address-enforcementoption
Enable/disable DHCP address enforcement (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP enforcement, clients can access the network without DHCP process.
"enable"Enable DHCP enforcement, data from clients that have not completed the DHCP process will be blocked.
dhcp-lease-timeunsigned int32
DHCP lease time in seconds for NAT IP address.
dhcp-option43-insertionoption
Enable/disable insertion of DHCP option 43 (default = enable).
"disable"Disable insertion of DHCP option 43.
"enable"Enable insertion of DHCP option 43.
dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 circuit-id insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 circuit-id insert.
"style-1"ASCII string composed of AP-MAC;SSID;SSID-TYPE. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx;wifi;s".
"style-2"ASCII string composed of AP-MAC. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".
"style-3"ASCII string composed of NETWORK-TYPE:WTPPROF-NAME:VLAN:SSID:AP-MODEL:AP-HOSTNAME:AP-MAC. For example,"WLAN:FAPS221E-default:100:wifi:PS221E:FortiAP-S221E:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".
dhcp-option82-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 insert.
"enable"Enable DHCP option 82 insert.
dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 remote-id insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 remote-id insert.
"style-1"ASCII string in the format "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx" containing MAC address of client device.
dynamic-vlanoption
Enable/disable dynamic VLAN assignment.
"disable"Disable dynamic VLAN assignment.
"enable"Enable dynamic VLAN assignment.
dynamic_mappingtable
eap-reauthoption
Enable/disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
"disable"Disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
"enable"Enable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
eap-reauth-intvunsigned int32
EAP re-authentication interval (1800 - 864000 sec, default = 86400).
eapol-key-retriesoption
Enable/disable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2) (default = enable).
"disable"Disable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2).
"enable"Enable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2).
encryptoption
Encryption protocol to use (only available when security is set to a WPA type).
"TKIP"Use TKIP encryption.
"AES"Use AES encryption.
"TKIP-AES"Use TKIP and AES encryption.
external-fast-roamingoption
Enable/disable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs not managed by the FortiGate (default = disable).
"disable"Disable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs.
"enable"Enable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs.
external-logoutstring
URL of external authentication logout server.
external-webstring
URL of external authentication web server.
external-web-formatoption
URL query parameter detection (default = auto-detect).
"auto-detect"Automatically detect if "external-web" URL has any query parameter.
"no-query-string""external-web" URL does not have any query parameter.
"partial-query-string""external-web" URL has some query parameters.
fast-bss-transitionoption
Enable/disable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT).
"enable"Enable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT).
fast-roamingoption
Enable/disable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication, where supported by clients (default = disable).
"disable"Disable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication.
"enable"Enable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication.
ft-mobility-domainunsigned int32
Mobility domain identifier in FT (1 - 65535, default = 1000).
ft-over-dsoption
Enable/disable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
"disable"Disable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
"enable"Enable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
ft-r0-key-lifetimeunsigned int32
Lifetime of the PMK-R0 key in FT, 1-65535 minutes.
gas-comeback-delayunsigned int32
GAS comeback delay (0 or 100 - 10000 milliseconds, default = 500).
gas-fragmentation-limitunsigned int32
GAS fragmentation limit (512 - 4096, default = 1024).
gtk-rekeyoption
Enable/disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
"disable"Disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
"enable"Enable GTK rekey for WPA security.
gtk-rekey-intvunsigned int32
GTK rekey interval (1800 - 864000 sec, default = 86400).
high-efficiencyoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax high efficiency (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax high efficiency.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax high efficiency.
hotspot20-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller hotspot20 hs-profile (maximum 1)
Hotspot 2.0 profile name.
igmp-snoopingoption
Enable/disable IGMP snooping.
"disable"Disable IGMP snooping.
"enable"Enable IGMP snooping.
intra-vap-privacyoption
Enable/disable blocking communication between clients on the same SSID (called intra-SSID privacy) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable intra-SSID privacy.
"enable"Enable intra-SSID privacy.
ipIPv4 address/mask
IP address and subnet mask for the local standalone NAT subnet.
ips-sensordatasource, refer to ips sensor (maximum 1)
IPS sensor name.
ipv6-rulesflags
Optional rules of IPv6 packets. For example, you can keep RA, RS and so on off of the wireless network.
"drop-icmp6ra"Drop ICMP6 Router Advertisement (RA) packets that originate from wireless clients.
"drop-icmp6rs"Drop ICMP6 Router Solicitation (RS) packets to be sent to wireless clients.
"drop-llmnr6"Drop Link-Local Multicast Name Resolution (LLMNR) packets
"drop-icmp6mld2"Drop ICMP6 Multicast Listener Report V2 (MLD2) packets
"drop-dhcp6s"Drop DHCP6 server generated packets that originate from wireless clients.
"drop-dhcp6c"Drop DHCP6 client generated packets to be sent to wireless clients.
"ndp-proxy"Enable IPv6 ndp proxy - send back na on behalf of the client and drop the ns.
"drop-ns-dad"Drop ICMP6 NS-DAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
"drop-ns-nondad"Drop ICMP6 NS-NonDAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
keypassword
WEP Key.
keyindexunsigned int32
WEP key index (1 - 4).
ldpcoption
VAP low-density parity-check (LDPC) coding configuration.
"disable"Disable LDPC.
"tx"Enable LDPC when transmitting traffic.
"rx"Enable LDPC when receiving traffic.
"rxtx"Enable LDPC when both receiving and transmitting traffic.
local-authenticationoption
Enable/disable AP local authentication.
"disable"Disable AP local authentication.
"enable"Enable AP local authentication.
local-bridgingoption
Enable/disable bridging of wireless and Ethernet interfaces on the FortiAP (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AP local VAP to Ethernet bridging.
"enable"Enable AP local VAP to Ethernet bridging.
local-lanoption
Allow/deny traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address (default = allow).
"deny"Deny traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address.
"allow"Allow traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address.
local-standaloneoption
Enable/disable AP local standalone (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AP local standalone.
"enable"Enable AP local standalone.
local-standalone-dnsoption
Enable/disable AP local standalone DNS.
"disable"Disable AP local standalone DNS.
"enable"Enable AP local standalone DNS.
local-standalone-dns-ipIPv4 address array
IPv4 addresses for the local standalone DNS.
local-standalone-natoption
Enable/disable AP local standalone NAT mode.
"disable"Disable AP local standalone NAT mode.
"enable"Enable AP local standalone NAT mode.
mac-auth-bypassoption
Enable/disable MAC authentication bypass.
"disable"Disable MAC authentication bypass.
"enable"Enable MAC authentication bypass.
mac-called-station-delimiteroption
MAC called station delimiter (default = hyphen).
"hyphen"Use hyphen as delimiter for called station.
"single-hyphen"Use single hyphen as delimiter for called station.
"colon"Use colon as delimiter for called station.
"none"No delimiter for called station.
mac-calling-station-delimiteroption
MAC calling station delimiter (default = hyphen).
"hyphen"Use hyphen as delimiter for calling station.
"single-hyphen"Use single hyphen as delimiter for calling station.
"colon"Use colon as delimiter for calling station.
"none"No delimiter for calling station.
mac-caseoption
MAC case (default = uppercase).
"uppercase"Use uppercase MAC.
"lowercase"Use lowercase MAC.
mac-filteroption
Enable/disable MAC filtering to block wireless clients by mac address.
"disable"Disable MAC filtering.
"enable"Enable MAC filtering.
mac-filter-listtable
mac-filter-policy-otheroption
Allow or block clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
"deny"Block clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
"allow"Allow clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
mac-password-delimiteroption
MAC authentication password delimiter (default = hyphen).
"hyphen"Use hyphen as delimiter for MAC auth password.
"single-hyphen"Use single hyphen as delimiter for MAC auth password.
"colon"Use colon as delimiter for MAC auth password.
"none"No delimiter for MAC auth password.
mac-username-delimiteroption
MAC authentication username delimiter (default = hyphen).
"hyphen"Use hyphen as delimiter for MAC auth username.
"single-hyphen"Use single hyphen as delimiter for MAC auth username.
"colon"Use colon as delimiter for MAC auth username.
"none"No delimiter for MAC auth username.
max-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
max-clients-apunsigned int32
Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP per AP radio (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
mbooption
Enable/disable Multiband Operation (default = disable).
"disable"Disable Multiband Operation (MBO).
"enable"Enable Multiband Operation (MBO).
mbo-cell-data-conn-prefoption
MBO cell data connection preference (0, 1, or 255, default = 1).
"excluded"Wi-Fi Agile Multiband AP does not want the Wi-Fi Agile Multiband STA to use the cellular data connection.
"prefer-not"Wi-Fi Agile Multiband AP prefers the Wi-Fi Agile Multiband STA should not use cellular data connection.
"prefer-use"Wi-Fi Agile Multiband AP prefers the Wi-Fi Agile Multiband STA should use cellular data connection.
me-disable-threshunsigned int32
Disable multicast enhancement when this many clients are receiving multicast traffic.
mesh-backhauloption
Enable/disable using this VAP as a WiFi mesh backhaul (default = disable). This entry is only available when security is set to a WPA type or open.
"disable"Disable mesh backhaul.
"enable"Enable mesh backhaul.
mpsk-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller mpsk-profile (maximum 1)
MPSK profile name.
mu-mimooption
Enable/disable Multi-user MIMO (default = enable).
"disable"Disable Multi-user MIMO.
"enable"Enable Multi-user MIMO.
multicast-enhanceoption
Enable/disable converting multicast to unicast to improve performance (default = disable).
"disable"Disable multicast enhancement.
"enable"Enable multicast enhancement.
multicast-rateoption
Multicast rate (0, 6000, 12000, or 24000 kbps, default = 0).
"0"Use the default multicast rate.
"6000"6 Mbps.
"12000"12 Mbps.
"24000"24 Mbps.
nacoption
Enable/disable network access control.
"disable"Disable network access control.
"enable"Enable network access control.
nac-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller nac-profile (maximum 1)
NAC profile name.
namestring, master key
Virtual AP name.
neighbor-report-dual-bandoption
Enable/disable dual-band neighbor report (default = disable).
"disable"Disable dual-band neighbor report.
"enable"Enable dual-band neighbor report.
okcoption
Enable/disable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC) (default = enable).
"disable"Disable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC).
"enable"Enable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC).
osenoption
Enable/disable OSEN as part of key management (default = disable).
"disable"Disable OSEN auth.
"enable"Enable OSEN auth.
owe-groupsflags
OWE-Groups.
"19"DH Group 19.
"20"DH Group 20.
"21"DH Group 21.
owe-transitionoption
Enable/disable OWE transition mode support.
"disable"Disable OWE transition mode support.
"enable"Enable OWE transition mode support.
owe-transition-ssidstring
OWE transition mode peer SSID.
passphrasepassword
WPA pre-shared key (PSK) to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
pmfoption
Protected Management Frames (PMF) support (default = disable).
"disable"Disable PMF completely.
"enable"Enable PMF but deny clients without PMF.
"optional"Enable PMF and allow clients without PMF.
pmf-assoc-comeback-timeoutunsigned int32
Protected Management Frames (PMF) comeback maximum timeout (1-20 sec).
pmf-sa-query-retry-timeoutunsigned int32
Protected Management Frames (PMF) SA query retry timeout interval (1 - 5 100s of msec).
port-macauthoption
Enable/disable LAN port MAC authentication (default = disable).
"disable"Disable LAN port MAC authentication.
"radius"Enable LAN port RADIUS-based MAC authentication.
"address-group"Enable LAN port address-group based MAC authentication.
port-macauth-reauth-timeoutunsigned int32
LAN port MAC authentication re-authentication timeout value (default = 7200 sec).
port-macauth-timeoutunsigned int32
LAN port MAC authentication idle timeout value (default = 600 sec).
portal-message-override-groupdatasource, refer to system replacemsg-group (maximum 1)
Replacement message group for this VAP (only available when security is set to a captive portal type).
portal-message-overridesobject
portal-typeoption
Captive portal functionality. Configure how the captive portal authenticates users and whether it includes a disclaimer.
"auth"Portal for authentication.
"auth+disclaimer"Portal for authentication and disclaimer.
"disclaimer"Portal for disclaimer.
"email-collect"Portal for email collection.
"cmcc"Portal for CMCC.
"cmcc-macauth"Portal for CMCC and MAC authentication.
"auth-mac"Portal for authentication and MAC authentication.
"external-auth"Portal for external portal authentication.
"external-macauth"Portal for external portal MAC authentication.
primary-wag-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wag-profile (maximum 1)
Primary wireless access gateway profile name.
probe-resp-suppressionoption
Enable/disable probe response suppression (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable probe response suppression.
"enable"Enable probe response suppression.
probe-resp-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to probe requests (-95 to -20, default = -80).
ptk-rekeyoption
Enable/disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
"disable"Disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
"enable"Enable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
ptk-rekey-intvunsigned int32
PTK rekey interval (1800 - 864000 sec, default = 86400).
qos-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller qos-profile (maximum 1)
Quality of service profile name.
quarantineoption
Enable/disable station quarantine (default = enable).
"disable"Disable station quarantine.
"enable"Enable station quarantine.
radio-2g-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 2.4G band (-95 to -20, default = -79).
radio-5g-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 5G band(-95 to -20, default = -76).
radio-sensitivityoption
Enable/disable software radio sensitivity (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable software radio sensitivity.
"enable"Enable software radio sensitivity.
radius-mac-authoption
Enable/disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication of clients (default = disable).
"disable"Disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication.
"enable"Enable RADIUS-based MAC authentication.
radius-mac-auth-serverdatasource, refer to user radius (maximum 1)
RADIUS-based MAC authentication server.
radius-mac-auth-usergroupsstring array
Selective user groups that are permitted for RADIUS mac authentication.
radius-mac-mpsk-authoption
Enable/disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication of clients for MPSK authentication (default = disable).
"disable"Disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication for MPSK authentication.
"enable"Enable RADIUS-based MAC authentication for MPSK authentication.
radius-mac-mpsk-timeoutunsigned int32
RADIUS MAC MPSK cache timeout interval (0 or 300 - 864000, default = 86400, 0 to disable caching).
radius-serverdatasource, refer to user radius (maximum 1)
RADIUS server to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
rates-11aflags
Allowed data rates for 802.11a.
"1"1 Mbps supported rate.
"1-basic"1 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"2"2 Mbps supported rate.
"2-basic"2 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"5.5"5.5 Mbps supported rate.
"5.5-basic"5.5 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"6"6 Mbps supported rate.
"6-basic"6 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"9"9 Mbps supported rate.
"9-basic"9 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"12"12 Mbps supported rate.
"12-basic"12 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"18"18 Mbps supported rate.
"18-basic"18 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"24"24 Mbps supported rate.
"24-basic"24 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"36"36 Mbps supported rate.
"36-basic"36 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"48"48 Mbps supported rate.
"48-basic"48 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"54"54 Mbps supported rate.
"54-basic"54 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"11"11 Mbps supported rate.
"11-basic"11 Mbps BSS basic rate.

"mcs1/1"Data rate for MCS index 1 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs2/1"Data rate for MCS index 2 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs3/1"Data rate for MCS index 3 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs4/1"Data rate for MCS index 4 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs5/1"Data rate for MCS index 5 with 1 spatial stream.

"mcs7/1"Data rate for MCS index 7 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs8/1"Data rate for MCS index 8 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs9/1"Data rate for MCS index 9 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs0/2"Data rate for MCS index 0 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs1/2"Data rate for MCS index 1 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs2/2"Data rate for MCS index 2 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs3/2"Data rate for MCS index 3 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs4/2"Data rate for MCS index 4 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs5/2"Data rate for MCS index 5 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs6/2"Data rate for MCS index 6 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs7/2"Data rate for MCS index 7 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs8/2"Data rate for MCS index 8 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs9/2"Data rate for MCS index 9 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs10/1"Data rate for MCS index 10 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs11/1"Data rate for MCS index 11 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs10/2"Data rate for MCS index 10 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs11/2"Data rate for MCS index 11 with 2 spatial streams.

sae-groupsflags
SAE-Groups.
"19"DH Group 19.
"20"DH Group 20.
"21"DH Group 21.
sae-h2e-onlyoption
Use hash-to-element-only mechanism for PWE derivation (default = disable).
"disable"Disable WPA3 SAE-H2E-only.
"enable"Enable WAP3 SAE-H2E-only.
sae-passwordpassword
WPA3 SAE password to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
sae-pkoption
Enable/disable WPA3 SAE-PK (default = disable).
"disable"Disable WPA3 SAE-PK.
"enable"Enable WAP3 SAE-PK.
sae-private-keystring
Private key used for WPA3 SAE-PK authentication.
scan-botnet-connectionsoption
Block or monitor connections to Botnet servers or disable Botnet scanning.
"disable"Do not scan connections to botnet servers.
"block"Block connections to botnet servers.
"monitor"Log connections to botnet servers.
scheduledatasource, refer to firewall schedule group, firewall schedule onetime, or firewall schedule recurring (maximum 16)
Firewall schedules for enabling this VAP on the FortiAP. This VAP will be enabled when at least one of the schedules is valid. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
secondary-wag-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wag-profile (maximum 1)
Secondary wireless access gateway profile name.
securityoption
Security mode for the wireless interface (default = wpa2-only-personal).
"wep64"WEP 64-bit.
"wep128"WEP 128-bit.
"open"Open.
"wpa-personal"WPA/WPA2 personal.
"wpa-enterprise"WPA/WPA2 enterprise.
"captive-portal"Captive portal.
"wpa-only-personal"WPA personal.
"wpa-only-enterprise"WPA enterprise.
"wpa2-only-personal"WPA2 personal.
"wpa2-only-enterprise"WPA2 enterprise.
"wpa-personal+captive-portal"WPA/WPA2 personal with captive portal.
"wpa-only-personal+captive-portal"WPA personal with captive portal.
"wpa2-only-personal+captive-portal"WPA2 personal with captive portal.
"osen"OSEN.
"wpa3-enterprise"WPA3 enterprise with 192-bit encryption and PMF mandatory.
"owe"Opportunistic wireless encryption.
"wpa3-sae"WPA3 SAE.
"wpa3-sae-transition"WPA3 SAE transition.
"wpa3-only-enterprise"WPA3 enterprise with PMF mandatory.
"wpa3-enterprise-transition"WPA3 enterprise with PMF optional.
security-exempt-listdatasource, refer to user security-exempt-list (maximum 1)
Optional security exempt list for captive portal authentication.
security-obsolete-optionoption
Enable/disable obsolete security options.
"disable"Disable obsolete security options (WPA only and WEP).
"enable"Enable obsolete security options (WPA only and WEP).
security-redirect-urlstring
Optional URL for redirecting users after they pass captive portal authentication.
selected-usergroupsdatasource, refer to user group
Selective user groups that are permitted to authenticate.
split-tunnelingoption
Enable/disable split tunneling (default = disable).
"disable"Disable split tunneling.
"enable"Enable split tunneling.
ssidstring
IEEE 802.11 service set identifier (SSID) for the wireless interface. Users who wish to use the wireless network must configure their computers to access this SSID name.
sticky-client-removeoption
Enable/disable sticky client remove to maintain good signal level clients in SSID (default = disable).
"disable"Disable sticky client remove.
"enable"Enable sticky client remove.
sticky-client-threshold-2gstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 2G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -79).
sticky-client-threshold-5gstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 5G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -76).
sticky-client-threshold-6gstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 6G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -76).
target-wake-timeoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax target wake time (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax target wake time.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax target wake time.
tkip-counter-measureoption
Enable/disable TKIP counter measure.
"disable"Disable TKIP counter measure.
"enable"Enable TKIP counter measure.
tunnel-echo-intervalunsigned int32
The time interval to send echo to both primary and secondary tunnel peers (1 - 65535 sec, default = 300).
tunnel-fallback-intervalunsigned int32
The time interval for secondary tunnel to fall back to primary tunnel (0 - 65535 sec, default = 7200).
usergroupdatasource, refer to user group
Firewall user group to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
utm-logoption
Enable/disable UTM logging.
"disable"Disable UTM logging.
"enable"Enable UTM logging.
utm-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller utm-profile (maximum 1)
UTM profile name.
utm-statusoption
Enable to add one or more security profiles (AV, IPS, etc.) to the VAP.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
vlan-autooption
Enable/disable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
"disable"Disable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
"enable"Enable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
vlan-nametable
vlan-pooltable
vlan-poolingoption
Enable/disable VLAN pooling, to allow grouping of multiple wireless controller VLANs into VLAN pools (default = disable). When set to wtp-group, VLAN pooling occurs with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
"wtp-group"Enable VLAN pooling with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
"round-robin"Enable VLAN pooling with round-robin VLAN assignment.
"hash"Enable VLAN pooling with hash-based VLAN assignment.
"disable"Disable VLAN pooling.
vlanidunsigned int32, support meta variable
Optional VLAN ID.
voice-enterpriseoption
Enable/disable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming (default = disable).
"disable"Disable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming.
"enable"Enable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming.
webfilter-profiledatasource, refer to webfilter profile (maximum 1)
WebFilter profile name.

 

wireless-controller/vap/dynamic_mapping (table)

Configure Virtual Access Points (VAPs).

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/vap/<vap_name>/dynamic_mapping
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/vap/<vap_name>/dynamic_mapping/<device_name>/<vdom_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions

"enable"

"enable"

"enable"[Default value]

atf-weightunsigned int32

authoption
Authentication protocol.
"radius"Use a RADIUS server to authenticate clients.
"usergroup"Use a firewall usergroup to authenticate clients.
"psk"Use a single Pre-shard Key (PSK) to authenticate all users.
auth-certdatasource, refer to vpn certificate local, or dynamic certificate local (maximum 1)
HTTPS server certificate.
auth-portal-addrstring
Address of captive portal.
beacon-advertisingflags
Fortinet beacon advertising IE data (default = empty).
"name"AP name.
"model"AP model abbreviation.
"serial-number"AP serial number.
beacon-protectionoption
"disable"
"enable"
broadcast-ssidoption
Enable/disable broadcasting the SSID (default = enable).
"disable"Disable broadcasting the SSID.
"enable"Enable broadcasting the SSID.
broadcast-suppressionflags
Optional suppression of broadcast messages. For example, you can keep DHCP messages, ARP broadcasts, and so on off of the wireless network.
"netbios-ns"Suppress NetBIOS name services packets with UDP port 137.
"netbios-ds"Suppress NetBIOS datagram services packets with UDP port 138.
"dhcp-up"Suppress broadcast uplink DHCP messages.
"dhcp-down"Suppress broadcast downlink DHCP messages.
"arp-known"Suppress broadcast ARP for known wireless clients.
"arp-unknown"Suppress broadcast ARP for unknown wireless clients.
"arp-reply"Suppress broadcast ARP reply from wireless clients.
"ipv6"Suppress IPv6 packets.
"dhcp-starvation"Suppress broadcast DHCP starvation req messages.
"arp-poison"Suppress ARP poison messages from wireless clients.
"all-other-mc"Suppress all other multicast messages.
"all-other-bc"Suppress all other broadcast messages.
"arp-proxy"Reply ARP requests for wireless clients as a proxy.
"dhcp-ucast"Convert downlink broadcast DHCP messages to unicast messages.
bss-color-partialoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax partial BSS color (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax partial BSS color.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax partial BSS color.
bstm-disassociation-imminentoption
Enable/disable forcing of disassociation after the BSTM request timer has been reached (default = enable).
"disable"Disable BSTM disassociation imminent.
"enable"Enable BSTM disassociation imminent.
bstm-load-balancing-disassoc-timerunsigned int32
Time interval for client to voluntarily leave AP before forcing a disassociation due to AP load-balancing (0 to 30, default = 10).
bstm-rssi-disassoc-timerunsigned int32
Time interval for client to voluntarily leave AP before forcing a disassociation due to low RSSI (0 to 2000, default = 200).
captive-portaloption
"disable"
"enable"
captive-portal-ac-namestring
Local-bridging captive portal ac-name.
captive-portal-auth-timeoutunsigned int32
Hard timeout - AP will always clear the session after timeout regardless of traffic (0 - 864000 sec, default = 0).
captive-portal-fw-accountingoption
"disable"
"enable"
captive-portal-macauth-radius-secretpassword
captive-portal-macauth-radius-serverstring
captive-portal-radius-secretpassword
captive-portal-radius-serverstring
captive-portal-session-timeout-intervalunsigned int32
client-countunsigned int32
dhcp-address-enforcementoption
Enable/disable DHCP address enforcement (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP enforcement, clients can access the network without DHCP process.
"enable"Enable DHCP enforcement, data from clients that have not completed the DHCP process will be blocked.
dhcp-lease-timeunsigned int32
DHCP lease time in seconds for NAT IP address.
dhcp-option43-insertionoption
Enable/disable insertion of DHCP option 43 (default = enable).
"disable"Disable insertion of DHCP option 43.
"enable"Enable insertion of DHCP option 43.
dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 circuit-id insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 circuit-id insert.
"style-1"ASCII string composed of AP-MAC;SSID;SSID-TYPE. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx;wifi;s".
"style-2"ASCII string composed of AP-MAC. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".
"style-3"ASCII string composed of NETWORK-TYPE:WTPPROF-NAME:VLAN:SSID:AP-MODEL:AP-HOSTNAME:AP-MAC. For example,"WLAN:FAPS221E-default:100:wifi:PS221E:FortiAP-S221E:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".
dhcp-option82-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 insert.
"enable"Enable DHCP option 82 insert.
dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 remote-id insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 remote-id insert.
"style-1"ASCII string in the format "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx" containing MAC address of client device.
dynamic-vlanoption
Enable/disable dynamic VLAN assignment.
"disable"Disable dynamic VLAN assignment.
"enable"Enable dynamic VLAN assignment.
eap-reauthoption
Enable/disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
"disable"Disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
"enable"Enable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
eap-reauth-intvunsigned int32
EAP re-authentication interval (1800 - 864000 sec, default = 86400).
eapol-key-retriesoption
Enable/disable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2) (default = enable).
"disable"Disable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2).
"enable"Enable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2).
encryptoption
Encryption protocol to use (only available when security is set to a WPA type).
"TKIP"Use TKIP encryption.
"AES"Use AES encryption.
"TKIP-AES"Use TKIP and AES encryption.
external-fast-roamingoption
Enable/disable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs not managed by the FortiGate (default = disable).
"disable"Disable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs.
"enable"Enable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs.
external-logoutstring
URL of external authentication logout server.
external-webstring
URL of external authentication web server.
external-web-formatoption
URL query parameter detection (default = auto-detect).
"auto-detect"Automatically detect if "external-web" URL has any query parameter.
"no-query-string""external-web" URL does not have any query parameter.
"partial-query-string""external-web" URL has some query parameters.
fast-bss-transitionoption
Enable/disable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT).
"enable"Enable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT).
fast-roamingoption
Enable/disable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication, where supported by clients (default = disable).
"disable"Disable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication.
"enable"Enable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication.
ft-mobility-domainunsigned int32
Mobility domain identifier in FT (1 - 65535, default = 1000).
ft-over-dsoption
Enable/disable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
"disable"Disable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
"enable"Enable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
ft-r0-key-lifetimeunsigned int32
Lifetime of the PMK-R0 key in FT, 1-65535 minutes.
gas-comeback-delayunsigned int32
GAS comeback delay (0 or 100 - 10000 milliseconds, default = 500).
gas-fragmentation-limitunsigned int32
GAS fragmentation limit (512 - 4096, default = 1024).
gtk-rekeyoption
Enable/disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
"disable"Disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
"enable"Enable GTK rekey for WPA security.
gtk-rekey-intvunsigned int32
GTK rekey interval (1800 - 864000 sec, default = 86400).
high-efficiencyoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax high efficiency (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax high efficiency.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax high efficiency.
hotspot20-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller hotspot20 hs-profile (maximum 1)
Hotspot 2.0 profile name.
igmp-snoopingoption
Enable/disable IGMP snooping.
"disable"Disable IGMP snooping.
"enable"Enable IGMP snooping.
intra-vap-privacyoption
Enable/disable blocking communication between clients on the same SSID (called intra-SSID privacy) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable intra-SSID privacy.
"enable"Enable intra-SSID privacy.
ipIPv4 address/mask
IP address and subnet mask for the local standalone NAT subnet.
ips-sensordatasource, refer to ips sensor (maximum 1)
IPS sensor name.
ipv6-rulesflags
Optional rules of IPv6 packets. For example, you can keep RA, RS and so on off of the wireless network.
"drop-icmp6ra"Drop ICMP6 Router Advertisement (RA) packets that originate from wireless clients.
"drop-icmp6rs"Drop ICMP6 Router Solicitation (RS) packets to be sent to wireless clients.
"drop-llmnr6"Drop Link-Local Multicast Name Resolution (LLMNR) packets
"drop-icmp6mld2"Drop ICMP6 Multicast Listener Report V2 (MLD2) packets
"drop-dhcp6s"Drop DHCP6 server generated packets that originate from wireless clients.
"drop-dhcp6c"Drop DHCP6 client generated packets to be sent to wireless clients.
"ndp-proxy"Enable IPv6 ndp proxy - send back na on behalf of the client and drop the ns.
"drop-ns-dad"Drop ICMP6 NS-DAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
"drop-ns-nondad"Drop ICMP6 NS-NonDAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
keypassword
WEP Key.
keyindexunsigned int32
WEP key index (1 - 4).
l3-roamingoption
"disable"
"enable"
l3-roaming-modeoption
"direct"
"indirect"
ldpcoption
VAP low-density parity-check (LDPC) coding configuration.
"disable"Disable LDPC.
"tx"Enable LDPC when transmitting traffic.
"rx"Enable LDPC when receiving traffic.
"rxtx"Enable LDPC when both receiving and transmitting traffic.
local-authenticationoption
Enable/disable AP local authentication.
"disable"Disable AP local authentication.
"enable"Enable AP local authentication.
local-bridgingoption
Enable/disable bridging of wireless and Ethernet interfaces on the FortiAP (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AP local VAP to Ethernet bridging.
"enable"Enable AP local VAP to Ethernet bridging.
local-lanoption
Allow/deny traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address (default = allow).
"deny"Deny traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address.
"allow"Allow traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address.
local-standaloneoption
Enable/disable AP local standalone (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AP local standalone.
"enable"Enable AP local standalone.
local-standalone-dnsoption
Enable/disable AP local standalone DNS.
"disable"Disable AP local standalone DNS.
"enable"Enable AP local standalone DNS.
local-standalone-dns-ipIPv4 address array
IPv4 addresses for the local standalone DNS.
local-standalone-natoption
Enable/disable AP local standalone NAT mode.
"disable"Disable AP local standalone NAT mode.
"enable"Enable AP local standalone NAT mode.
local-switchingoption
"disable"
"enable"
mac-auth-bypassoption
Enable/disable MAC authentication bypass.
"disable"Disable MAC authentication bypass.
"enable"Enable MAC authentication bypass.
mac-called-station-delimiteroption
MAC called station delimiter (default = hyphen).
"hyphen"Use hyphen as delimiter for called station.
"single-hyphen"Use single hyphen as delimiter for called station.
"colon"Use colon as delimiter for called station.
"none"No delimiter for called station.
mac-calling-station-delimiteroption
MAC calling station delimiter (default = hyphen).
"hyphen"Use hyphen as delimiter for calling station.
"single-hyphen"Use single hyphen as delimiter for calling station.
"colon"Use colon as delimiter for calling station.
"none"No delimiter for calling station.
mac-caseoption
MAC case (default = uppercase).
"uppercase"Use uppercase MAC.
"lowercase"Use lowercase MAC.
mac-filteroption
Enable/disable MAC filtering to block wireless clients by mac address.
"disable"Disable MAC filtering.
"enable"Enable MAC filtering.
mac-filter-policy-otheroption
Allow or block clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
"deny"Block clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
"allow"Allow clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
mac-password-delimiteroption
MAC authentication password delimiter (default = hyphen).
"hyphen"Use hyphen as delimiter for MAC auth password.
"single-hyphen"Use single hyphen as delimiter for MAC auth password.
"colon"Use colon as delimiter for MAC auth password.
"none"No delimiter for MAC auth password.
mac-username-delimiteroption
MAC authentication username delimiter (default = hyphen).
"hyphen"Use hyphen as delimiter for MAC auth username.
"single-hyphen"Use single hyphen as delimiter for MAC auth username.
"colon"Use colon as delimiter for MAC auth username.
"none"No delimiter for MAC auth username.
max-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
max-clients-apunsigned int32
Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP per AP radio (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
mbooption
Enable/disable Multiband Operation (default = disable).
"disable"Disable Multiband Operation (MBO).
"enable"Enable Multiband Operation (MBO).
mbo-cell-data-conn-prefoption
MBO cell data connection preference (0, 1, or 255, default = 1).
"excluded"Wi-Fi Agile Multiband AP does not want the Wi-Fi Agile Multiband STA to use the cellular data connection.
"prefer-not"Wi-Fi Agile Multiband AP prefers the Wi-Fi Agile Multiband STA should not use cellular data connection.
"prefer-use"Wi-Fi Agile Multiband AP prefers the Wi-Fi Agile Multiband STA should use cellular data connection.
me-disable-threshunsigned int32
Disable multicast enhancement when this many clients are receiving multicast traffic.
mesh-backhauloption
Enable/disable using this VAP as a WiFi mesh backhaul (default = disable). This entry is only available when security is set to a WPA type or open.
"disable"Disable mesh backhaul.
"enable"Enable mesh backhaul.
mpskoption
"disable"
"enable"
mpsk-concurrent-clientsunsigned int32
mpsk-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller mpsk-profile (maximum 1)
MPSK profile name.
mu-mimooption
Enable/disable Multi-user MIMO (default = enable).
"disable"Disable Multi-user MIMO.
"enable"Enable Multi-user MIMO.
multicast-enhanceoption
Enable/disable converting multicast to unicast to improve performance (default = disable).
"disable"Disable multicast enhancement.
"enable"Enable multicast enhancement.
multicast-rateoption
Multicast rate (0, 6000, 12000, or 24000 kbps, default = 0).
"0"Use the default multicast rate.
"6000"6 Mbps.
"12000"12 Mbps.
"24000"24 Mbps.
nacoption
Enable/disable network access control.
"disable"Disable network access control.
"enable"Enable network access control.
nac-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller nac-profile (maximum 1)
NAC profile name.
nas-filter-ruleoption
"disable"
"enable"
neighbor-report-dual-bandoption
Enable/disable dual-band neighbor report (default = disable).
"disable"Disable dual-band neighbor report.
"enable"Enable dual-band neighbor report.
okcoption
Enable/disable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC) (default = enable).
"disable"Disable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC).
"enable"Enable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC).
osenoption
Enable/disable OSEN as part of key management (default = disable).
"disable"Disable OSEN auth.
"enable"Enable OSEN auth.
owe-groupsflags
OWE-Groups.
"19"DH Group 19.
"20"DH Group 20.
"21"DH Group 21.
owe-transitionoption
Enable/disable OWE transition mode support.
"disable"Disable OWE transition mode support.
"enable"Enable OWE transition mode support.
owe-transition-ssidstring
OWE transition mode peer SSID.
passphrasepassword
WPA pre-shared key (PSK) to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
pmfoption
Protected Management Frames (PMF) support (default = disable).
"disable"Disable PMF completely.
"enable"Enable PMF but deny clients without PMF.
"optional"Enable PMF and allow clients without PMF.
pmf-assoc-comeback-timeoutunsigned int32
Protected Management Frames (PMF) comeback maximum timeout (1-20 sec).
pmf-sa-query-retry-timeoutunsigned int32
Protected Management Frames (PMF) SA query retry timeout interval (1 - 5 100s of msec).
port-macauthoption
Enable/disable LAN port MAC authentication (default = disable).
"disable"Disable LAN port MAC authentication.
"radius"Enable LAN port RADIUS-based MAC authentication.
"address-group"Enable LAN port address-group based MAC authentication.
port-macauth-reauth-timeoutunsigned int32
LAN port MAC authentication re-authentication timeout value (default = 7200 sec).
port-macauth-timeoutunsigned int32
LAN port MAC authentication idle timeout value (default = 600 sec).
portal-message-override-groupdatasource, refer to system replacemsg-group (maximum 1)
Replacement message group for this VAP (only available when security is set to a captive portal type).
portal-typeoption
Captive portal functionality. Configure how the captive portal authenticates users and whether it includes a disclaimer.
"auth"Portal for authentication.
"auth+disclaimer"Portal for authentication and disclaimer.
"disclaimer"Portal for disclaimer.
"email-collect"Portal for email collection.
"cmcc"Portal for CMCC.
"cmcc-macauth"Portal for CMCC and MAC authentication.
"auth-mac"Portal for authentication and MAC authentication.
"external-auth"Portal for external portal authentication.
"external-macauth"Portal for external portal MAC authentication.
primary-wag-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wag-profile (maximum 1)
Primary wireless access gateway profile name.
probe-resp-suppressionoption
Enable/disable probe response suppression (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable probe response suppression.
"enable"Enable probe response suppression.
probe-resp-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to probe requests (-95 to -20, default = -80).
ptk-rekeyoption
Enable/disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
"disable"Disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
"enable"Enable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
ptk-rekey-intvunsigned int32
PTK rekey interval (1800 - 864000 sec, default = 86400).
qos-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller qos-profile (maximum 1)
Quality of service profile name.
quarantineoption
Enable/disable station quarantine (default = enable).
"disable"Disable station quarantine.
"enable"Enable station quarantine.
radio-2g-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 2.4G band (-95 to -20, default = -79).
radio-5g-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 5G band(-95 to -20, default = -76).
radio-sensitivityoption
Enable/disable software radio sensitivity (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable software radio sensitivity.
"enable"Enable software radio sensitivity.
radius-mac-authoption
Enable/disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication of clients (default = disable).
"disable"Disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication.
"enable"Enable RADIUS-based MAC authentication.
radius-mac-auth-block-intervalunsigned int32
radius-mac-auth-serverdatasource, refer to user radius (maximum 1)
RADIUS-based MAC authentication server.
radius-mac-auth-usergroupsstring array
Selective user groups that are permitted for RADIUS mac authentication.
radius-mac-mpsk-authoption
Enable/disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication of clients for MPSK authentication (default = disable).
"disable"Disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication for MPSK authentication.
"enable"Enable RADIUS-based MAC authentication for MPSK authentication.
radius-mac-mpsk-timeoutunsigned int32
RADIUS MAC MPSK cache timeout interval (0 or 300 - 864000, default = 86400, 0 to disable caching).
radius-serverdatasource, refer to user radius (maximum 1)
RADIUS server to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
rates-11aflags
Allowed data rates for 802.11a.
"1"1 Mbps supported rate.
"1-basic"1 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"2"2 Mbps supported rate.
"2-basic"2 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"5.5"5.5 Mbps supported rate.
"5.5-basic"5.5 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"6"6 Mbps supported rate.
"6-basic"6 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"9"9 Mbps supported rate.
"9-basic"9 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"12"12 Mbps supported rate.
"12-basic"12 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"18"18 Mbps supported rate.
"18-basic"18 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"24"24 Mbps supported rate.
"24-basic"24 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"36"36 Mbps supported rate.
"36-basic"36 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"48"48 Mbps supported rate.
"48-basic"48 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"54"54 Mbps supported rate.
"54-basic"54 Mbps BSS basic rate.
"11"11 Mbps supported rate.
"11-basic"11 Mbps BSS basic rate.
rates-11ac-mcs-mapstring
rates-11ac-ss12flags
Allowed data rates for 802.11ac with 1 or 2 spatial streams.
"mcs0/1"Data rate for MCS index 0 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs1/1"Data rate for MCS index 1 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs2/1"Data rate for MCS index 2 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs3/1"Data rate for MCS index 3 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs4/1"Data rate for MCS index 4 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs5/1"Data rate for MCS index 5 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs6/1"Data rate for MCS index 6 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs7/1"Data rate for MCS index 7 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs8/1"Data rate for MCS index 8 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs9/1"Data rate for MCS index 9 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs0/2"Data rate for MCS index 0 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs1/2"Data rate for MCS index 1 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs2/2"Data rate for MCS index 2 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs3/2"Data rate for MCS index 3 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs4/2"Data rate for MCS index 4 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs5/2"Data rate for MCS index 5 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs6/2"Data rate for MCS index 6 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs7/2"Data rate for MCS index 7 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs8/2"Data rate for MCS index 8 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs9/2"Data rate for MCS index 9 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs10/1"Data rate for MCS index 10 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs11/1"Data rate for MCS index 11 with 1 spatial stream.
"mcs10/2"Data rate for MCS index 10 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs11/2"Data rate for MCS index 11 with 2 spatial streams.
