"mcs12/2"Data rate for MCS index 12 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs13/2"Data rate for MCS index 13 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs14/2"Data rate for MCS index 14 with 2 spatial streams.
"mcs15/2"Data rate for MCS index 15 with 2 spatial streams.
rates-11n-ss34flags
Allowed data rates for 802.11n with 3 or 4 spatial streams.
"mcs16/3"Data rate for MCS index 16 with 3 spatial streams.
"mcs17/3"Data rate for MCS index 17 with 3 spatial streams.
"mcs18/3"Data rate for MCS index 18 with 3 spatial streams.
"mcs19/3"Data rate for MCS index 19 with 3 spatial streams.
"mcs20/3"Data rate for MCS index 20 with 3 spatial streams.
"mcs21/3"Data rate for MCS index 21 with 3 spatial streams.
"mcs22/3"Data rate for MCS index 22 with 3 spatial streams.
"mcs23/3"Data rate for MCS index 23 with 3 spatial streams.
"mcs24/4"Data rate for MCS index 24 with 4 spatial streams.
"mcs25/4"Data rate for MCS index 25 with 4 spatial streams.
"mcs26/4"Data rate for MCS index 26 with 4 spatial streams.
"mcs27/4"Data rate for MCS index 27 with 4 spatial streams.
"mcs28/4"Data rate for MCS index 28 with 4 spatial streams.
"mcs29/4"Data rate for MCS index 29 with 4 spatial streams.
"mcs30/4"Data rate for MCS index 30 with 4 spatial streams.
"mcs31/4"Data rate for MCS index 31 with 4 spatial streams.
roaming-acct-interim-updateoption
"disable"
"enable"
sae-groupsflags
SAE-Groups.
"19"DH Group 19.
"20"DH Group 20.
"21"DH Group 21.
sae-h2e-onlyoption
Use hash-to-element-only mechanism for PWE derivation (default = disable).
"disable"Disable WPA3 SAE-H2E-only.
"enable"Enable WAP3 SAE-H2E-only.
sae-hnp-onlyoption
"disable"
"enable"
sae-passwordpassword
WPA3 SAE password to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
sae-pkoption
Enable/disable WPA3 SAE-PK (default = disable).
"disable"Disable WPA3 SAE-PK.
"enable"Enable WAP3 SAE-PK.
sae-private-keystring
Private key used for WPA3 SAE-PK authentication.
scan-botnet-connectionsoption
Block or monitor connections to Botnet servers or disable Botnet scanning.
"disable"Do not scan connections to botnet servers.
"block"Block connections to botnet servers.
"monitor"Log connections to botnet servers.
scheduledatasource, refer to firewall schedule group, firewall schedule onetime, or firewall schedule recurring
Firewall schedules for enabling this VAP on the FortiAP. This VAP will be enabled when at least one of the schedules is valid. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
secondary-wag-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wag-profile (maximum 1)
Secondary wireless access gateway profile name.
securityoption
Security mode for the wireless interface (default = wpa2-only-personal).
"wep64"WEP 64-bit.
"wep128"WEP 128-bit.
"open"Open.
"wpa-personal"WPA/WPA2 personal.
"wpa-enterprise"WPA/WPA2 enterprise.
"captive-portal"Captive portal.
"wpa-only-personal"WPA personal.
"wpa-only-enterprise"WPA enterprise.
"wpa2-only-personal"WPA2 personal.
"wpa2-only-enterprise"WPA2 enterprise.
"wpa-personal+captive-portal"WPA/WPA2 personal with captive portal.
"wpa-only-personal+captive-portal"WPA personal with captive portal.
"wpa2-only-personal+captive-portal"WPA2 personal with captive portal.
"osen"OSEN.
"wpa3-enterprise"WPA3 enterprise with 192-bit encryption and PMF mandatory.
"owe"Opportunistic wireless encryption.
"wpa3-sae"WPA3 SAE.
"wpa3-sae-transition"WPA3 SAE transition.
"wpa3-only-enterprise"WPA3 enterprise with PMF mandatory.
"wpa3-enterprise-transition"WPA3 enterprise with PMF optional.
security-exempt-listdatasource, refer to user security-exempt-list (maximum 1)
Optional security exempt list for captive portal authentication.
security-obsolete-optionoption
Enable/disable obsolete security options.
"disable"Disable obsolete security options (WPA only and WEP).
"enable"Enable obsolete security options (WPA only and WEP).
security-redirect-urlstring
Optional URL for redirecting users after they pass captive portal authentication.
selected-usergroupsdatasource, refer to user group
Selective user groups that are permitted to authenticate.
split-tunnelingoption
Enable/disable split tunneling (default = disable).
"disable"Disable split tunneling.
"enable"Enable split tunneling.
ssidstring
IEEE 802.11 service set identifier (SSID) for the wireless interface. Users who wish to use the wireless network must configure their computers to access this SSID name.
sticky-client-removeoption
Enable/disable sticky client remove to maintain good signal level clients in SSID (default = disable).
"disable"Disable sticky client remove.
"enable"Enable sticky client remove.
sticky-client-threshold-2gstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 2G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -79).
sticky-client-threshold-5gstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 5G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -76).
sticky-client-threshold-6gstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 6G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -76).
target-wake-timeoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax target wake time (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax target wake time.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax target wake time.
tkip-counter-measureoption
Enable/disable TKIP counter measure.
"disable"Disable TKIP counter measure.
"enable"Enable TKIP counter measure.
tunnel-echo-intervalunsigned int32
The time interval to send echo to both primary and secondary tunnel peers (1 - 65535 sec, default = 300).
tunnel-fallback-intervalunsigned int32
The time interval for secondary tunnel to fall back to primary tunnel (0 - 65535 sec, default = 7200).
usergroupdatasource, refer to user group
Firewall user group to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
utm-logoption
Enable/disable UTM logging.
"disable"Disable UTM logging.
"enable"Enable UTM logging.
utm-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller utm-profile (maximum 1)
UTM profile name.
utm-statusoption
Enable to add one or more security profiles (AV, IPS, etc.) to the VAP.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
vdomdatasource, refer to system vdom
vlan-autooption
Enable/disable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
"disable"Disable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
"enable"Enable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
vlan-poolingoption
Enable/disable VLAN pooling, to allow grouping of multiple wireless controller VLANs into VLAN pools (default = disable). When set to wtp-group, VLAN pooling occurs with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
"wtp-group"Enable VLAN pooling with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
"round-robin"Enable VLAN pooling with round-robin VLAN assignment.
"hash"Enable VLAN pooling with hash-based VLAN assignment.
"disable"Disable VLAN pooling.
vlanidunsigned int32, support meta variable
Optional VLAN ID.
voice-enterpriseoption
Enable/disable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming (default = disable).
"disable"Disable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming.
"enable"Enable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming.
webfilter-profiledatasource, refer to webfilter profile (maximum 1)
WebFilter profile name.

 

wireless-controller/vap/mac-filter-list (table)

Create a list of MAC addresses for MAC address filtering.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/vap/<vap_name>/mac-filter-list
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/vap/<vap_name>/mac-filter-list/<mac-filter-list_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
idsequence, master key
ID.
macmac address
MAC address.
mac-filter-policyoption
Deny or allow the client with this MAC address.
"deny"Block the client with this MAC address.
"allow"Allow the client with this MAC address.

Override auth-login-failed-page message with message from portal-message-overrides group.
auth-login-pagestring
Override auth-login-page message with message from portal-message-overrides group.
auth-reject-pagestring
Override auth-reject-page message with message from portal-message-overrides group.

wireless-controller/wag-profile (table)

Configure wireless access gateway (WAG) profiles used for tunnels on AP.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wag-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wag-profile/<wag-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Comment.
dhcp-ip-addrIPv4 address
IP address of the monitoring DHCP request packet sent through the tunnel.
namestring, master key
Tunnel profile name.
ping-intervalunsigned int32
Interval between two tunnel monitoring echo packets (1 - 65535 sec, default = 1).
ping-numberunsigned int32
Number of the tunnel monitoring echo packets (1 - 65535, default = 5).
return-packet-timeoutunsigned int32
Window of time for the return packets from the tunnel's remote end (1 - 65535 sec, default = 160).
tunnel-typeoption
Tunnel type.
"gre"GRE Ethernet tunnel.
"l2tpv3"L2TPV3 Ethernet Pseudowire.
wag-ipIPv4 address
IP Address of the wireless access gateway.
wag-portunsigned int32
UDP port of the wireless access gateway.

 

wireless-controller/wids-profile (table)

Configure wireless intrusion detection system (WIDS) profiles.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wids-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wids-profile/<wids-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
ap-auto-suppressoption
Enable/disable on-wire rogue AP auto-suppression (default = disable).
"disable"Disable on-wire rogue AP auto-suppression.
"enable"Enable on-wire rogue AP auto-suppression.
ap-bgscan-disable-schedulesdatasource, refer to firewall schedule recurring, firewall schedule group, or firewall schedule onetime (maximum 16)
Firewall schedules for turning off FortiAP radio background scan. Background scan will be disabled when at least one of the schedules is valid. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
ap-bgscan-durationunsigned int32
Listen time on scanning a channel (10 - 1000 msec, default = 30).
ap-bgscan-idleunsigned int32
Wait time for channel inactivity before scanning this channel (0 - 1000 msec, default = 20).
ap-bgscan-intvunsigned int32
Period between successive channel scans (1 - 600 sec, default = 3).
ap-bgscan-periodunsigned int32
Period between background scans (10 - 3600 sec, default = 600).
ap-bgscan-report-intvunsigned int32
Period between background scan reports (15 - 600 sec, default = 30).
ap-fgscan-report-intvunsigned int32
Period between foreground scan reports (15 - 600 sec, default = 15).
ap-scanoption
Enable/disable rogue AP detection.
"disable"Disable rogue AP detection.
"enable"Enable rogue AP detection.
ap-scan-passiveoption
Enable/disable passive scanning. Enable means do not send probe request on any channels (default = disable).
"disable"Passive scanning only on DFS channels.
"enable"Passive scanning on all channels.
ap-scan-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP to report detected rogue AP (-95 to -20, default = -90).
asleap-attackoption
Enable/disable asleap attack detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable asleap attack detection.
"enable"Enable asleap attack detection.
assoc-flood-threshunsigned int32
The threshold value for association frame flooding.
assoc-flood-timeunsigned int32
Number of seconds after which a station is considered not connected.
assoc-frame-floodoption
Enable/disable association frame flooding detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable association frame flooding detection.
"enable"Enable association frame flooding detection.
auth-flood-threshunsigned int32
The threshold value for authentication frame flooding.
auth-flood-timeunsigned int32
Number of seconds after which a station is considered not connected.
auth-frame-floodoption
Enable/disable authentication frame flooding detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable authentication frame flooding detection.
"enable"Enable authentication frame flooding detection.
commentstring
Comment.
deauth-broadcastoption
Enable/disable broadcasting de-authentication detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable broadcast de-authentication detection.
"enable"Enable broadcast de-authentication detection.
deauth-unknown-src-threshunsigned int32
Threshold value per second to deauth unknown src for DoS attack (0: no limit).
eapol-fail-floodoption
Enable/disable EAPOL-Failure flooding (to AP) detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable EAPOL-Failure flooding detection.
"enable"Enable EAPOL-Failure flooding detection.
eapol-fail-intvunsigned int32
The detection interval for EAPOL-Failure flooding (1 - 3600 sec).
eapol-fail-threshunsigned int32
The threshold value for EAPOL-Failure flooding in specified interval.
eapol-logoff-floodoption
Enable/disable EAPOL-Logoff flooding (to AP) detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable EAPOL-Logoff flooding detection.
"enable"Enable EAPOL-Logoff flooding detection.
eapol-logoff-intvunsigned int32
The detection interval for EAPOL-Logoff flooding (1 - 3600 sec).
eapol-logoff-threshunsigned int32
The threshold value for EAPOL-Logoff flooding in specified interval.
eapol-pre-fail-floodoption
Enable/disable premature EAPOL-Failure flooding (to STA) detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable premature EAPOL-Failure flooding detection.
"enable"Enable premature EAPOL-Failure flooding detection.
eapol-pre-fail-intvunsigned int32
The detection interval for premature EAPOL-Failure flooding (1 - 3600 sec).
eapol-pre-fail-threshunsigned int32
The threshold value for premature EAPOL-Failure flooding in specified interval.
eapol-pre-succ-floodoption
Enable/disable premature EAPOL-Success flooding (to STA) detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable premature EAPOL-Success flooding detection.
"enable"Enable premature EAPOL-Success flooding detection.
eapol-pre-succ-intvunsigned int32
The detection interval for premature EAPOL-Success flooding (1 - 3600 sec).
eapol-pre-succ-threshunsigned int32
The threshold value for premature EAPOL-Success flooding in specified interval.
eapol-start-floodoption
Enable/disable EAPOL-Start flooding (to AP) detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable EAPOL-Start flooding detection.
"enable"Enable EAPOL-Start flooding detection.
eapol-start-intvunsigned int32
The detection interval for EAPOL-Start flooding (1 - 3600 sec).
eapol-start-threshunsigned int32
The threshold value for EAPOL-Start flooding in specified interval.
eapol-succ-floodoption
Enable/disable EAPOL-Success flooding (to AP) detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable EAPOL-Success flooding detection.
"enable"Enable EAPOL-Success flooding detection.
eapol-succ-intvunsigned int32
The detection interval for EAPOL-Success flooding (1 - 3600 sec).
eapol-succ-threshunsigned int32
The threshold value for EAPOL-Success flooding in specified interval.
invalid-mac-ouioption
Enable/disable invalid MAC OUI detection.
"disable"Disable invalid MAC OUI detection.
"enable"Enable invalid MAC OUI detection.
long-duration-attackoption
Enable/disable long duration attack detection based on user configured threshold (default = disable).
"disable"Disable long duration attack detection.
"enable"Enable long duration attack detection.
long-duration-threshunsigned int32
Threshold value for long duration attack detection (1000 - 32767 usec, default = 8200).
namestring, master key
WIDS profile name.
null-ssid-probe-respoption
Enable/disable null SSID probe response detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable null SSID probe resp detection.
"enable"Enable null SSID probe resp detection.
sensor-modeoption
Scan nearby WiFi stations (default = disable).
"disable"Disable the scan.
"foreign"Enable the scan and monitor foreign channels. Foreign channels are all other available channels than the current operating channel.
"both"Enable the scan and monitor both foreign and home channels. Select this option to monitor all WiFi channels.
spoofed-deauthoption
Enable/disable spoofed de-authentication attack detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable spoofed de-authentication attack detection.
"enable"Enable spoofed de-authentication attack detection.
weak-wep-ivoption
Enable/disable weak WEP IV (Initialization Vector) detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable weak WEP IV detection.
"enable"Enable weak WEP IV detection.
wireless-bridgeoption
Enable/disable wireless bridge detection (default = disable).
"disable"Disable wireless bridge detection.
"enable"Enable wireless bridge detection.

 

wireless-controller/wtp (table)

Configure Wireless Termination Points (WTPs), that is, FortiAPs or APs to be managed by FortiGate.

Require device/vdom scope member.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp/<wtp-id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
adminoption
Configure how the FortiGate operating as a wireless controller discovers and manages this WTP, AP or FortiAP.
"disable"FortiGate wireless controller is configured to not provide service to this WTP.
"enable"FortiGate wireless controller is configured to provide service to this WTP.
"discovered"FortiGate wireless controller discovers the WTP, AP, or FortiAP though discovery or join request messages.
allowaccessflags
Control management access to the managed WTP, FortiAP, or AP. Separate entries with a space.
"https"HTTPS access.
"ssh"SSH access.
"snmp"SNMP access.
apcfg-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller apcfg-profile (maximum 1)
AP local configuration profile name.
bonjour-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller bonjour-profile (maximum 1)
Bonjour profile name.
coordinate-latitudestring
WTP latitude coordinate.
coordinate-longitudestring
WTP longitude coordinate.
firmware-provisionstring
Firmware version to provision to this FortiAP on bootup (major.minor.build, i.e. 6.2.1234).
firmware-provision-latestoption
Enable/disable one-time automatic provisioning of the latest firmware version.
"disable"Do not automatically provision the latest available firmware.
"once"Automatically attempt a one-time upgrade to the latest available firmware version.
image-downloadoption
Enable/disable WTP image download.
"disable"Disable WTP image download at join time.
"enable"Enable WTP image download at join time.
indexunsigned int32
ip-fragment-preventingflags
Method(s) by which IP fragmentation is prevented for control and data packets through CAPWAP tunnel (default = tcp-mss-adjust).
"tcp-mss-adjust"TCP maximum segment size adjustment.
"icmp-unreachable"Drop packet and send ICMP Destination Unreachable
lanobject
led-stateoption
Enable to allow the FortiAPs LEDs to light. Disable to keep the LEDs off. You may want to keep the LEDs off so they are not distracting in low light areas etc.
"disable"Keep the LEDs on this FortiAP off.
"enable"Allow the LEDs on this FortiAP to light.
locationstring
Field for describing the physical location of the WTP, AP or FortiAP.
login-passwdpassword
Set the managed WTP, FortiAP, or AP's administrator password.
login-passwd-changeoption
Change or reset the administrator password of a managed WTP, FortiAP or AP (yes, default, or no, default = no).
"no"Do not change the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password.
"yes"Change the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password. Use the login-password option to set the password.
"default"Keep the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password set to the factory default.
mesh-bridge-enableoption
Enable/disable mesh Ethernet bridge when WTP is configured as a mesh branch/leaf AP.
"disable"Turn off mesh Ethernet bridge on the WTP.
"enable"Turn on mesh Ethernet bridge on the WTP.
"default"Use mesh Ethernet bridge local setting on the WTP.
namestring
WTP, AP or FortiAP configuration name.
override-allowaccessoption
Enable to override the WTP profile management access configuration.
"disable"Use the WTP profile management access configuration.
"enable"Override the WTP profile management access configuration.
override-ip-fragmentoption
Enable/disable overriding the WTP profile IP fragment prevention setting.
"disable"Use the WTP profile IP fragment prevention setting.
"enable"Override the WTP profile IP fragment prevention setting.
override-lanoption
Enable to override the WTP profile LAN port setting.
"disable"Use the WTP profile LAN port setting.
"enable"Override the WTP profile LAN port setting.
override-led-stateoption
Enable to override the profile LED state setting for this FortiAP. You must enable this option to use the led-state command to turn off the FortiAP's LEDs.
"disable"Use the WTP profile LED state.
"enable"Override the WTP profile LED state.
override-login-passwd-changeoption
Enable to override the WTP profile login-password (administrator password) setting.
"disable"Use the the WTP profile login-password (administrator password) setting.
"enable"Override the WTP profile login-password (administrator password) setting.
override-split-tunneloption
Enable/disable overriding the WTP profile split tunneling setting.
"disable"Use the WTP profile split tunneling setting.
"enable"Override the WTP profile split tunneling setting.
override-wan-port-modeoption
Enable/disable overriding the wan-port-mode in the WTP profile.
"disable"Use the wan-port-mode in the WTP profile.
"enable"Override the WTP profile wan-port-mode.
radio-1object
radio-2object
radio-3object
radio-4object
regiondatasource, refer to wireless-controller region (maximum 1)
Region name WTP is associated with.
region-xstring
Relative horizontal region coordinate (between 0 and 1).
region-ystring
Relative vertical region coordinate (between 0 and 1).
scope memberscope object, refer to device object
split-tunneling-acltable
split-tunneling-acl-local-ap-subnetoption
Enable/disable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL (default = disable).
"disable"Disable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL.
"enable"Enable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL.
split-tunneling-acl-pathoption
Split tunneling ACL path is local/tunnel.
"tunnel"Split tunneling ACL list traffic will be tunnel.
"local"Split tunneling ACL list traffic will be local NATed.
tun-mtu-downlinkunsigned int32
The MTU of downlink CAPWAP tunnel (576 - 1500 bytes or 0; 0 means the local MTU of FortiAP; default = 0).
tun-mtu-uplinkunsigned int32
The maximum transmission unit (MTU) of uplink CAPWAP tunnel (576 - 1500 bytes or 0; 0 means the local MTU of FortiAP; default = 0).
uuiduuid
Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).
wan-port-modeoption
Enable/disable using the FortiAP WAN port as a LAN port.
"wan-lan"Use the FortiAP WAN port as a LAN port.
"wan-only"Do not use the WAN port as a LAN port.
wtp-idstring, master key
WTP ID.
wtp-modeoption
WTP, AP, or FortiAP operating mode (default = normal).
"normal"Normal WTP, AP, or FortiAP.
"remote"Remote WTP, AP, or FortiAP.
wtp-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wtp-profile (maximum 1)
WTP profile name to apply to this WTP, AP or FortiAP.

Require device/vdom scope member.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp/<wtp-id>/lan

"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP ESL port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP ESL port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP ESL port to WTP WAN port.

LAN port mode.
"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.

"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.

port2-modeoption
LAN port 2 mode.
"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
port2-ssiddatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, or system interface (maximum 1)
Bridge LAN port 2 to SSID.
port3-modeoption
LAN port 3 mode.
"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
port3-ssiddatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, or system interface (maximum 1)
Bridge LAN port 3 to SSID.
port4-modeoption
LAN port 4 mode.
"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
port4-ssiddatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, or system interface (maximum 1)
Bridge LAN port 4 to SSID.
port5-modeoption
LAN port 5 mode.
"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
port5-ssiddatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, or system interface (maximum 1)
Bridge LAN port 5 to SSID.
port6-modeoption
LAN port 6 mode.
"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
port6-ssiddatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, or system interface (maximum 1)
Bridge LAN port 6 to SSID.
port7-modeoption
LAN port 7 mode.
"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
port7-ssiddatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, or system interface (maximum 1)
Bridge LAN port 7 to SSID.
port8-modeoption
LAN port 8 mode.
"offline"Offline.
"bridge-to-wan"Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
"bridge-to-ssid"Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
"nat-to-wan"NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
port8-ssiddatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, or system interface (maximum 1)
Bridge LAN port 8 to SSID.
scope memberscope object, refer to device object

 

wireless-controller/wtp/radio-1 (object)

Configuration options for radio 1.

Require device/vdom scope member.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp/<wtp-id>/radio-1
Attribute ListDescriptions
auto-power-highunsigned int32
The upper bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-leveloption
Enable/disable automatic power-level adjustment to prevent co-channel interference (default = enable).
"disable"Disable automatic transmit power adjustment.
"enable"Enable automatic transmit power adjustment.
auto-power-lowunsigned int32
The lower bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-targetstring
Target of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (-95 to -20, default = -70).
bandoption
WiFi band that Radio 1 operates on.
"802.11a"802.11a.
"802.11b"802.11b.
"802.11g"802.11g/b.
"802.11n"802.11n/g/b at 2.4GHz.
"802.11n-5G"802.11n/a at 5GHz.
"802.11n,g-only"802.11n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11g-only"802.11g.
"802.11n-only"802.11n at 2.4GHz.
"802.11n-5G-only"802.11n at 5GHz.
"802.11ac"802.11ac/n/a.
"802.11ac,n-only"802.11ac/n.
"802.11ac-only"802.11ac.
"802.11ax-5G"802.11ax/ac/n/a at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac-only"802.11ax/ac at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac,n-only"802.11ax/ac/n at 5GHz.
"802.11ax-5G-only"802.11ax at 5GHz.
"802.11ax"802.11ax/n/g/b at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax,n-only"802.11ax/n at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax,n,g-only"802.11ax/n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax-only"802.11ax at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ac-2G"802.11ac at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax-6G"802.11ax at 6GHz.
channelstring array
Selected list of wireless radio channels.
drma-manual-modeoption
Radio mode to be used for DRMA manual mode (default = ncf).
"ap"Set the radio to AP mode.
"monitor"Set the radio to monitor mode
"ncf"Select and set the radio mode based on NCF score.
"ncf-peek"Select the radio mode based on NCF score, but do not apply.
override-bandoption
Enable to override the WTP profile band setting.
"disable"Use the WTP profile band setting.
"enable"Override the WTP profile band setting.
override-channeloption
Enable to override WTP profile channel settings.
"disable"Use WTP profile channel settings.
"enable"Override WTP profile channel settings.
override-txpoweroption
Enable to override the WTP profile power level configuration.
"disable"Use the WTP profile power level configuration.
"enable"Override the WTP profile power level configuration.
override-vapsoption
Enable to override WTP profile Virtual Access Point (VAP) settings.
"disable"Use WTP profile VAP settings.
"enable"Override WTP profile VAP settings.
power-levelunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power level as a percentage of the maximum EIRP power (0 - 100, default = 100).
power-modeoption
Set radio effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP) in dBm or by a percentage of the maximum EIRP (default = percentage). This power takes into account both radio transmit power and antenna gain. Higher power level settings may be constrained by local regulatory requirements and AP capabilities.
"dBm"Set radio EIRP power in dBm.
"percentage"Set radio EIRP power by percentage.
power-valueunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power in dBm (1 - 33, default = 27).
radio-idunsigned int32
scope memberscope object, refer to device object
vap-alloption
Configure method for assigning SSIDs to this FortiAP (default = automatically assign tunnel SSIDs).
"tunnel"Automatically select tunnel SSIDs.
"bridge"Automatically select local-bridging SSIDs.
"manual"Manually select SSIDs.
vap1string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 1
vap2string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 2
vap3string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 3
vap4string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 4
vap5string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 5
vap6string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 6
vap7string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 7
vap8string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 8
vapsdatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, wireless-controller vap-group, or system interface
Manually selected list of Virtual Access Points (VAPs).

wireless-controller/wtp-profile (table)

Configure WTP profiles or FortiAP profiles that define radio settings for manageable FortiAP platforms.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
_is_factory_settingoption
"disable"[Default value]
"enable"
"ext"
allowaccessflags
Control management access to the managed WTP, FortiAP, or AP. Separate entries with a space.
"https"HTTPS access.
"ssh"SSH access.
"snmp"SNMP access.
ap-countryoption
Country in which this WTP, FortiAP, or AP will operate (default = NA, automatically use the country configured for the current VDOM).
"AL"ALBANIA
"DZ"ALGERIA
"AR"ARGENTINA
"AM"ARMENIA
"AU"AUSTRALIA
"AT"AUSTRIA
"AZ"AZERBAIJAN
"BH"BAHRAIN

"--"NO_COUNTRY_SET
ap-handoffoption
Enable/disable AP handoff of clients to other APs (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AP handoff.
"enable"Enable AP handoff.
apcfg-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller apcfg-profile (maximum 1)
AP local configuration profile name.
ble-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller ble-profile (maximum 1)
Bluetooth Low Energy profile name.
commentstring
Comment.
console-loginoption
Enable/disable FortiAP console login access (default = enable).
"disable"Disable FAP console login access.
"enable"Enable FAP console login access.
control-message-offloadflags
Enable/disable CAPWAP control message data channel offload.
"ebp-frame"Ekahau blink protocol (EBP) frames.
"aeroscout-tag"AeroScout tag.
"ap-list"Rogue AP list.
"sta-list"Rogue STA list.
"sta-cap-list"STA capability list.
"stats"WTP, radio, VAP, and STA statistics.
"aeroscout-mu"AeroScout Mobile Unit (MU) report.
"sta-health"STA health log.
"spectral-analysis"Spectral analysis report.
deny-mac-listtable
dtls-in-kerneloption
Enable/disable data channel DTLS in kernel.
"disable"Disable data channel DTLS in kernel.
"enable"Enable data channel DTLS in kernel.
dtls-policyflags
WTP data channel DTLS policy (default = clear-text).
"clear-text"Clear Text Data Channel.
"dtls-enabled"DTLS Enabled Data Channel.
"ipsec-vpn"IPsec VPN Data Channel.
energy-efficient-ethernetoption
Enable/disable use of energy efficient Ethernet on WTP.
"disable"Disable use of energy efficient Ethernet on WTP.
"enable"Enable use of energy efficient Ethernet on WTP.
esl-ses-dongleobject
ext-info-enableoption
Enable/disable station/VAP/radio extension information.
"disable"Disable station/VAP/radio extension information.
"enable"Enable station/VAP/radio extension information.
frequency-handoffoption
Enable/disable frequency handoff of clients to other channels (default = disable).
"disable"Disable frequency handoff.
"enable"Enable frequency handoff.
handoff-roamingoption
Enable/disable client load balancing during roaming to avoid roaming delay (default = disable).
"disable"Disable handoff roaming.
"enable"Enable handoff roaming.
handoff-rssiunsigned int32
Minimum received signal strength indicator (RSSI) value for handoff (20 - 30, default = 25).
handoff-sta-threshunsigned int32
Threshold value for AP handoff.
indoor-outdoor-deploymentoption
Set to allow indoor/outdoor-only channels under regulatory rules (default = platform-determined).
"platform-determined"Set AP deployment type based on its platform.
"outdoor"Set AP deployment type to outdoor.
"indoor"Set AP deployment type to indoor.
ip-fragment-preventingflags
Method(s) by which IP fragmentation is prevented for control and data packets through CAPWAP tunnel (default = tcp-mss-adjust).
"tcp-mss-adjust"TCP maximum segment size adjustment.
"icmp-unreachable"Drop packet and send ICMP Destination Unreachable
lanobject
lbsobject
led-schedulesdatasource, refer to firewall schedule group, firewall schedule recurring, or firewall schedule onetime (maximum 16)
Recurring firewall schedules for illuminating LEDs on the FortiAP. If led-state is enabled, LEDs will be visible when at least one of the schedules is valid. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
led-stateoption
Enable/disable use of LEDs on WTP (default = disable).
"disable"Disable use of LEDs on WTP.
"enable"Enable use of LEDs on WTP.
lldpoption
Enable/disable Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) for the WTP, FortiAP, or AP (default = enable).
"disable"Disable LLDP.
"enable"Enable LLDP.
login-passwdpassword
Set the managed WTP, FortiAP, or AP's administrator password.
login-passwd-changeoption
Change or reset the administrator password of a managed WTP, FortiAP or AP (yes, default, or no, default = no).
"no"Do not change the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password.
"yes"Change the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password. Use the login-password option to set the password.
"default"Keep the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password set to the factory default.
max-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of stations (STAs) supported by the WTP (default = 0, meaning no client limitation).
namestring, master key
WTP (or FortiAP or AP) profile name.
platformobject
poe-modeoption
Set the WTP, FortiAP, or AP's PoE mode.
"auto"Automatically detect the PoE mode.
"8023af"Use 802.3af PoE mode.
"8023at"Use 802.3at PoE mode.
"power-adapter"Use the power adapter to control the PoE mode.
"full"Use full power mode.
"high"Use high power mode.
"low"Use low power mode.
radio-1object
radio-2object
radio-3object
radio-4object
split-tunneling-acltable
split-tunneling-acl-local-ap-subnetoption
Enable/disable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL (default = disable).
"disable"Disable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL.
"enable"Enable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL.
split-tunneling-acl-pathoption
Split tunneling ACL path is local/tunnel.
"tunnel"Split tunneling ACL list traffic will be tunnel.
"local"Split tunneling ACL list traffic will be local NATed.
syslog-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller syslog-profile (maximum 1)
System log server configuration profile name.
tun-mtu-downlinkunsigned int32
The MTU of downlink CAPWAP tunnel (576 - 1500 bytes or 0; 0 means the local MTU of FortiAP; default = 0).
tun-mtu-uplinkunsigned int32
The maximum transmission unit (MTU) of uplink CAPWAP tunnel (576 - 1500 bytes or 0; 0 means the local MTU of FortiAP; default = 0).
wan-port-authoption
Set WAN port authentication mode (default = none).
"none"Disable WAN port authentication.
"802.1x"Enable WAN port 802.1x authentication.
wan-port-auth-methodsoption
WAN port 802.1x supplicant EAP methods (default = all).
"all"Do not specify any EAP methods.
"EAP-FAST"Enable EAP-FAST.
"EAP-TLS"Enable EAP-TLS.
"EAP-PEAP"Enable EAP-PEAP.
wan-port-auth-passwordpassword
Set WAN port 802.1x supplicant password.
wan-port-auth-usrnamestring
Set WAN port 802.1x supplicant user name.
wan-port-modeoption
Enable/disable using a WAN port as a LAN port.
"wan-lan"Enable using a WAN port as a LAN port.
"wan-only"Disable using a WAN port as a LAN port.

 

wireless-controller/wtp-profile/deny-mac-list (table)

List of MAC addresses that are denied access to this WTP, FortiAP, or AP.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/deny-mac-list
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/deny-mac-list/<deny-mac-list_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
idsequence, master key
ID.
macmac address
A WiFi device with this MAC address is denied access to this WTP, FortiAP or AP.

 

wireless-controller/wtp-profile/esl-ses-dongle (object)

ESL SES-imagotag dongle configuration.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/esl-ses-dongle
Attribute ListDescriptions
apc-addr-typeoption
ESL SES-imagotag APC address type (default = fqdn).
"fqdn"Fully Qualified Domain Name address.
"ip"IPv4 address.
apc-fqdnstring
FQDN of ESL SES-imagotag Access Point Controller (APC).
apc-ipIPv4 address
IP address of ESL SES-imagotag Access Point Controller (APC).
apc-portunsigned int32
Port of ESL SES-imagotag Access Point Controller (APC).
coex-leveloption
ESL SES-imagotag dongle coexistence level (default = none).
"none"No support for coexistence of USB-Dongle with WiFi AP.
compliance-leveloption
Compliance levels for the ESL solution integration (default = compliance-level-2).
"compliance-level-2"Compliance Level 2 - Full Cloud Support, IoT and Fast-Response.
esl-channeloption
ESL SES-imagotag dongle channel (default = 127).
"0"ESL channel 0.
"1"ESL channel 1.
"2"ESL channel 2.
"3"ESL channel 3.
"4"ESL channel 4.
"5"ESL channel 5.
"6"ESL channel 6.
"7"ESL channel 7.
"8"ESL channel 8.
"9"ESL channel 9.
"10"ESL channel 10.
"127"Managed channel enabled, indicates that the APC (server) is setting the esl-channel via the slot channel
"-1"No esl-channel is set.
output-poweroption
ESL SES-imagotag dongle output power (default = A).
"a"About 15mW.
"b"About 7mW.
"c"About 5mW.
"d"About 1mW.
"e"About 13mW.
"f"About 10mW.
"g"About 3mW.
"h"About 2mW.
scd-enableoption
Enable/disable ESL SES-imagotag Serial Communication Daemon (SCD) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable ESL SES-imagotag SCD.
"enable"Enable ESL SES-imagotag SCD.
tls-cert-verificationoption
Enable/disable TLS certificate verification (default = enable).
"disable"Disable TLS Certificate verification.
"enable"Enable TLS Certificate verification.
tls-fqdn-verificationoption
Enable/disable TLS certificate verification (default = disable).
"disable"Disable TLS FQDN verification.
"enable"Enable TLS FQDN verification.

wireless-controller/wtp-profile/lbs (object)

Set various location based service (LBS) options.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/lbs
Attribute ListDescriptions
aeroscoutoption
Enable/disable AeroScout Real Time Location Service (RTLS) support (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AeroScout support.
"enable"Enable AeroScout support.
aeroscout-ap-macoption
Use BSSID or board MAC address as AP MAC address in AeroScout AP messages (default = bssid).
"bssid"Use BSSID as AP MAC address in AeroScout AP messages.
"board-mac"Use board MAC address as AP MAC address in AeroScout AP messages.
aeroscout-mmu-reportoption
Enable/disable compounded AeroScout tag and MU report (default = enable).
"disable"Disable compounded AeroScout tag and MU report.
"enable"Enable compounded AeroScout tag and MU report.
aeroscout-muoption
Enable/disable AeroScout Mobile Unit (MU) support (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AeroScout MU mode support.
"enable"Enable AeroScout MU mode support.
aeroscout-mu-factorunsigned int32
AeroScout MU mode dilution factor (default = 20).
aeroscout-mu-timeoutunsigned int32
AeroScout MU mode timeout (0 - 65535 sec, default = 5).
aeroscout-server-ipIPv4 address
IP address of AeroScout server.
aeroscout-server-portunsigned int32
AeroScout server UDP listening port.
ekahau-blink-modeoption
Enable/disable Ekahau blink mode (now known as AiRISTA Flow) to track and locate WiFi tags (default = disable).
"disable"Disable Ekahau blink mode.
"enable"Enable Ekahau blink mode.
ekahau-tagmac address
WiFi frame MAC address or WiFi Tag.
erc-server-ipIPv4 address
IP address of Ekahau RTLS Controller (ERC).
erc-server-portunsigned int32
Ekahau RTLS Controller (ERC) UDP listening port.
fortipresenceoption
Enable/disable FortiPresence to monitor the location and activity of WiFi clients even if they don't connect to this WiFi network (default = disable).
"disable"Disable FortiPresence.
"foreign"FortiPresence monitors foreign channels only. Foreign channels mean all other available channels than the current operating channel of the WTP, AP, or FortiAP.
"both"Enable FortiPresence on both foreign and home channels. Select this option to have FortiPresence monitor all WiFi channels.
fortipresence-bleoption
Enable/disable FortiPresence finding and reporting BLE devices.
"disable"Disable FortiPresence finding and reporting BLE devices.
"enable"Enable FortiPresence finding and reporting BLE devices.
fortipresence-frequencyunsigned int32
FortiPresence report transmit frequency (5 - 65535 sec, default = 30).
fortipresence-portunsigned int32
UDP listening port of FortiPresence server (default = 3000).
fortipresence-projectstring
FortiPresence project name (max. 16 characters, default = fortipresence).
fortipresence-rogueoption
Enable/disable FortiPresence finding and reporting rogue APs.
"disable"Disable FortiPresence finding and reporting rogue APs.
"enable"Enable FortiPresence finding and reporting rogue APs.
fortipresence-secretpassword
FortiPresence secret password (max. 16 characters).
fortipresence-serverIPv4 address
IP address of FortiPresence server.
fortipresence-server-addr-typeoption
FortiPresence server address type (default = ipv4).
"fqdn"Fully Qualified Domain Name address.
"ipv4"IPv4 address.
fortipresence-server-fqdnstring
FQDN of FortiPresence server.
fortipresence-unassocoption
Enable/disable FortiPresence finding and reporting unassociated stations.
"disable"Disable FortiPresence finding and reporting unassociated stations.
"enable"Enable FortiPresence finding and reporting unassociated stations.
station-locateoption
Enable/disable client station locating services for all clients, whether associated or not (default = disable).
"disable"Disable station locating service.
"enable"Enable station locating service.

 

wireless-controller/wtp-profile/platform (object)

WTP, FortiAP, or AP platform.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/platform
Attribute ListDescriptions
_local_platform_strstring
ddscanoption
Enable/disable use of one radio for dedicated full-band scanning to detect RF characterization and wireless threat management.
"disable"Disable dedicated full-band scan mode.
"enable"Enable dedicated full-band scan mode.
modeoption
Configure operation mode of 5G radios (default = single-5G).
"dual-5G"Configure radios as one lower 5GHz band, one higher 5GHz band and one 2.4GHz band respectively.
"single-5G"Configure radios as one 5GHz band, one 2.4GHz band, and one dedicated monitor or sniffer.
typeoption
WTP, FortiAP or AP platform type. There are built-in WTP profiles for all supported FortiAP models. You can select a built-in profile and customize it or create a new profile.
"220B"FAP220B/221B.
"210B"FAP210B.
"222B"FAP222B.
"112B"FAP112B.
"320B"FAP320B.
"11C"FAP11C.
"14C"FAP14C.
"223B"FAP223B.
"28C"FAP28C.
"320C"FAP320C.
"221C"FAP221C.
"25D"FAP25D.
"222C"FAP222C.
"224D"FAP224D.
"214B"FK214B.
"21D"FAP21D.
"24D"FAP24D.
"112D"FAP112D.
"223C"FAP223C.
"321C"FAP321C.
"C220C"FAPC220C.
"C225C"FAPC225C.
"S321C"FAPS321C.
"S323C"FAPS323C.
"FWF"FortiWiFi local radio.
"S311C"FAPS311C.
"S313C"FAPS313C.
"AP-11N"Default 11n AP.
"S322C"FAPS322C.
"S321CR"FAPS321CR.
"S322CR"FAPS322CR.
"S323CR"FAPS323CR.
"S421E"FAPS421E.

"U433F"FAPU433F.

"431F"FAP431F.

"432F"FAP432F.

"U231F"FAPU231F.

"U234F"FAPU234F.
"U432F"FAPU432F.
"431FL"FAP431FL.
"432FR"FAP432FR.
"433FL"FAP433FL.
"231FL"FAP231FL.
"231G"FAP231G.
"233G"FAP233G.
"431G"FAP431G.
"433G"FAP433G.
"U231G"FAPU231G.
"U441G"FAPU441G.

 

wireless-controller/wtp-profile/radio-1 (object)

Configuration options for radio 1.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/radio-1
Attribute ListDescriptions
airtime-fairnessoption
Enable/disable airtime fairness (default = disable).
"disable"Disable airtime fairness (ATF) support.
"enable"Enable airtime fairness (ATF) support.
amsduoption
Enable/disable 802.11n AMSDU support. AMSDU can improve performance if supported by your WiFi clients (default = enable).
"disable"Disable AMSDU support.
"enable"Enable AMSDU support.
ap-sniffer-addrmac address
MAC address to monitor.
ap-sniffer-bufsizeunsigned int32
Sniffer buffer size (1 - 32 MB, default = 16).
ap-sniffer-chanunsigned int32
Channel on which to operate the sniffer (default = 6).
ap-sniffer-ctloption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi control frame (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
ap-sniffer-dataoption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi data frame (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi data frame
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi data frame
ap-sniffer-mgmt-beaconoption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management Beacon frames (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi management beacon frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management beacon frame.
ap-sniffer-mgmt-otheroption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management other frames (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
ap-sniffer-mgmt-probeoption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management probe frames (default = enable).
"disable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
arrp-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller arrp-profile (maximum 1)
Distributed Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) profile name to assign to the radio.
auto-power-highunsigned int32
The upper bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-leveloption
Enable/disable automatic power-level adjustment to prevent co-channel interference (default = enable).
"disable"Disable automatic transmit power adjustment.
"enable"Enable automatic transmit power adjustment.
auto-power-lowunsigned int32
The lower bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-targetstring
Target of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (-95 to -20, default = -70).
bandoption
WiFi band that Radio 1 operates on.
"802.11a"802.11a.
"802.11b"802.11b.
"802.11g"802.11g/b.
"802.11n"802.11n/g/b at 2.4GHz.
"802.11n-5G"802.11n/a at 5GHz.
"802.11ac"802.11ac/n/a.
"802.11g-only"802.11g.
"802.11n-only"802.11n at 2.4GHz.
"802.11n-5G-only"802.11n at 5GHz.
"802.11n,g-only"802.11n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ac,n-only"802.11ac/n.
"802.11ac-only"802.11ac.
"802.11ax-5G"802.11ax/ac/n/a at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac-only"802.11ax/ac at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac,n-only"802.11ax/ac/n at 5GHz.
"802.11ax-5G-only"802.11ax at 5GHz.
"802.11ax"802.11ax/n/g/b at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax,n-only"802.11ax/n at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax,n,g-only"802.11ax/n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax-only"802.11ax at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ac-2G"802.11ac at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax-6G"802.11ax at 6GHz.
band-5g-typeoption
WiFi 5G band type.
"5g-full"Full 5G band.
"5g-high"High 5G band.
"5g-low"Low 5G band.
bandwidth-admission-controloption
Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) bandwidth admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use. A request to join the wireless network is only allowed if the access point has enough bandwidth to support it.
"disable"Disable WMM bandwidth admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM bandwidth admission control.
bandwidth-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum bandwidth capacity allowed (1 - 600000 Kbps, default = 2000).
beacon-intervalunsigned int32
Beacon interval. The time between beacon frames in milliseconds. Actual range of beacon interval depends on the AP platform type (default = 100).
bss-colorunsigned int32
BSS color value for this 11ax radio (0 - 63, disable = 0, default = 0).
bss-color-modeoption
BSS color mode for this 11ax radio (default = auto).
"auto"Automatically select BSS color value on AP.
"static"Set BSS color value on this radio based on 'bss-color' CLI.
call-admission-controloption
Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) call admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use for VoIP calls. New VoIP calls are only accepted if there is enough bandwidth available to support them.
"disable"Disable WMM call admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM call admission control.
call-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum number of Voice over WLAN (VoWLAN) phones supported by the radio (0 - 60, default = 10).
channelstring array
Selected list of wireless radio channels.
channel-bondingoption
Channel bandwidth: 160,80, 40, or 20MHz. Channels may use both 20 and 40 by enabling coexistence.
"80MHz"80 MHz channel width.
"40MHz"40 MHz channel width.
"20MHz"20 MHz channel width.
"160MHz"160 MHz channel width.
channel-utilizationoption
Enable/disable measuring channel utilization.
"disable"Disable measuring channel utilization.
"enable"Enable measuring channel utilization.
coexistenceoption
Enable/disable allowing both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio (default = enable).
"disable"Disable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
"enable"Enable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
darrpoption
Enable/disable Distributed Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) to make sure the radio is always using the most optimal channel (default = disable).
"disable"Disable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
"enable"Enable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
drmaoption
Enable/disable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA).
"enable"Enable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA).
drma-sensitivityoption
Network Coverage Factor (NCF) percentage required to consider a radio as redundant (default = low).
"low"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 100%.
"medium"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 95%.
"high"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 90%.
dtimunsigned int32
Delivery Traffic Indication Map (DTIM) period (1 - 255, default = 1). Set higher to save battery life of WiFi client in power-save mode.
frag-thresholdunsigned int32
Maximum packet size that can be sent without fragmentation (800 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
iperf-protocoloption
Iperf test protocol (default = "UDP").
"udp"UDP.
"tcp"TCP.
iperf-server-portunsigned int32
Iperf service port number.
max-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of stations (STAs) or WiFi clients supported by the radio. Range depends on the hardware.
max-distanceunsigned int32
Maximum expected distance between the AP and clients (0 - 54000 m, default = 0).
modeoption
Mode of radio 1. Radio 1 can be disabled, configured as an access point, a rogue AP monitor, a sniffer, or a station.
"disabled"Radio 1 is disabled.
"ap"Radio 1 operates as an access point that allows WiFi clients to connect to your network.
"monitor"Radio 1 operates as a dedicated monitor. As a monitor, the radio scans for other WiFi access points and adds them to the Rogue AP monitor list.
"sniffer"Radio 1 operates as a sniffer capturing WiFi frames on air.
"sam"Radio 1 operates as a station that can connect to a neighboring AP for connectivity and health check.
power-levelunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power level as a percentage of the maximum EIRP power (0 - 100, default = 100).
power-modeoption
Set radio effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP) in dBm or by a percentage of the maximum EIRP (default = percentage). This power takes into account both radio transmit power and antenna gain. Higher power level settings may be constrained by local regulatory requirements and AP capabilities.
"dBm"Set radio EIRP power in dBm.
"percentage"Set radio EIRP power by percentage.
power-valueunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power in dBm (1 - 33, default = 27).
powersave-optimizeflags
Enable client power-saving features such as TIM, AC VO, and OBSS etc.
"tim"TIM bit for client in power save mode.
"ac-vo"Use AC VO priority to send out packets in the power save queue.
"no-obss-scan"Do not put OBSS scan IE into beacon and probe response frames.
"no-11b-rate"Do not send frame using 11b data rate.
"client-rate-follow"Adapt transmitting PHY rate with receiving PHY rate from a client.
protection-modeoption
Enable/disable 802.11g protection modes to support backwards compatibility with older clients (rtscts, ctsonly, disable).
"rtscts"Enable 802.11g protection RTS/CTS mode.
"ctsonly"Enable 802.11g protection CTS only mode.
"disable"Disable 802.11g protection mode.
radio-idunsigned int32
rts-thresholdunsigned int32
Maximum packet size for RTS transmissions, specifying the maximum size of a data packet before RTS/CTS (256 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
sam-bssidmac address
BSSID for WiFi network.
sam-captive-portaloption
Enable/disable Captive Portal Authentication (default = disable).
"disable"Disable Captive Portal Authentication.
"enable"Enable Captive Portal Authentication.
sam-cwp-failure-stringstring
Failure identification on the page after an incorrect login.
sam-cwp-match-stringstring
Identification string from the captive portal login form.
sam-cwp-passwordpassword
Password for captive portal authentication.
sam-cwp-success-stringstring
Success identification on the page after a successful login.
sam-cwp-test-urlstring
Website the client is trying to access.
sam-cwp-usernamestring
Username for captive portal authentication.
sam-passwordpassword
Passphrase for WiFi network connection.
sam-report-intvunsigned int32
SAM report interval (sec), 0 for a one-time report.
sam-security-typeoption
Select WiFi network security type (default = "wpa-personal").
"open"Open.
"wpa-personal"WPA/WPA2 personal.
"wpa-enterprise"WPA/WPA2 enterprise.
sam-serverstring
sam-server-fqdnstring
SAM test server domain name.
sam-server-ipIPv4 address
SAM test server IP address.
sam-server-typeoption
Select SAM server type (default = "IP").
"ip"IPv4 address.
"fqdn"Fully Qualified Domain Name address.
sam-ssidstring
SSID for WiFi network.
sam-testoption
Select SAM test type (default = "PING").
"ping"PING test.
"iperf"IPERF test.
sam-usernamestring
Username for WiFi network connection.
short-guard-intervaloption
Use either the short guard interval (Short GI) of 400 ns or the long guard interval (Long GI) of 800 ns.
"disable"Select the 800 ns long guard interval (Long GI).
"enable"Select the 400 ns short guard interval (Short GI).
transmit-optimizeflags
Packet transmission optimization options including power saving, aggregation limiting, retry limiting, etc. All are enabled by default.
"disable"Disable packet transmission optimization.
"power-save"Tag client as operating in power save mode if excessive transmit retries occur.
"aggr-limit"Set aggregation limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
"retry-limit"Set software retry limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
"send-bar"Limit transmission of BAR frames.
vap-alloption
Configure method for assigning SSIDs to this FortiAP (default = automatically assign tunnel SSIDs).
"tunnel"Automatically select tunnel SSIDs.
"bridge"Automatically select local-bridging SSIDs.
"manual"Manually select SSIDs.
vap1string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 1
vap2string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 2
vap3string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 3
vap4string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 4
vap5string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 5
vap6string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 6
vap7string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 7
vap8string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 8
vapsdatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, wireless-controller vap-group, or system interface
Manually selected list of Virtual Access Points (VAPs).
wids-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wids-profile (maximum 1)
Wireless Intrusion Detection System (WIDS) profile name to assign to the radio.
zero-wait-dfsoption
Enable/disable zero wait DFS on radio (default = enable).
"disable"Disable zero wait DFS
"enable"Enable zero wait DFS

"802.11n,g-only"802.11n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ac,n-only"802.11ac/n.
"802.11ac-only"802.11ac.
"802.11ax-5G"802.11ax/ac/n/a at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac-only"802.11ax/ac at 5GHz.

"802.11ax-5G-only"802.11ax at 5GHz.

"disable"Disable WMM bandwidth admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM bandwidth admission control.
bandwidth-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum bandwidth capacity allowed (1 - 600000 Kbps, default = 2000).

Beacon interval. The time between beacon frames in milliseconds. Actual range of beacon interval depends on the AP platform type (default = 100).
bss-colorunsigned int32

"auto"Automatically select BSS color value on AP.
"static"Set BSS color value on this radio based on 'bss-color' CLI.

Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) call admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use for VoIP calls. New VoIP calls are only accepted if there is enough bandwidth available to support them.
"disable"Disable WMM call admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM call admission control.
call-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum number of Voice over WLAN (VoWLAN) phones supported by the radio (0 - 60, default = 10).

Selected list of wireless radio channels.

"disable"Disable measuring channel utilization.
"enable"Enable measuring channel utilization.

"disable"Disable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
"enable"Enable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.

"disable"Disable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
"enable"Enable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
drmaoption
Enable/disable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA).
"enable"Enable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA).

"low"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 100%.
"medium"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 95%.
"high"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 90%.
dtimunsigned int32
Delivery Traffic Indication Map (DTIM) period (1 - 255, default = 1). Set higher to save battery life of WiFi client in power-save mode.
frag-thresholdunsigned int32
Maximum packet size that can be sent without fragmentation (800 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
iperf-protocoloption
Iperf test protocol (default = "UDP").
"udp"UDP.
"tcp"TCP.

max-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of stations (STAs) or WiFi clients supported by the radio. Range depends on the hardware.
max-distanceunsigned int32
Maximum expected distance between the AP and clients (0 - 54000 m, default = 0).
modeoption
Mode of radio 2. Radio 2 can be disabled, configured as an access point, a rogue AP monitor, a sniffer, or a station.
"disabled"Radio 2 is disabled.
"ap"Radio 2 operates as an access point that allows WiFi clients to connect to your network.
"monitor"Radio 2 operates as a dedicated monitor. As a monitor, the radio scans for other WiFi access points and adds them to the Rogue AP monitor list.
"sniffer"Radio 2 operates as a sniffer capturing WiFi frames on air.
"sam"Radio 2 operates as a station that can connect to a neighboring AP for connectivity and health check.
power-levelunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power level as a percentage of the maximum EIRP power (0 - 100, default = 100).
power-modeoption
Set radio effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP) in dBm or by a percentage of the maximum EIRP (default = percentage). This power takes into account both radio transmit power and antenna gain. Higher power level settings may be constrained by local regulatory requirements and AP capabilities.
"dBm"Set radio EIRP power in dBm.
"percentage"Set radio EIRP power by percentage.

Radio EIRP power in dBm (1 - 33, default = 27).

Enable client power-saving features such as TIM, AC VO, and OBSS etc.
"tim"TIM bit for client in power save mode.
"ac-vo"Use AC VO priority to send out packets in the power save queue.
"no-obss-scan"Do not put OBSS scan IE into beacon and probe response frames.
"no-11b-rate"Do not send frame using 11b data rate.
"client-rate-follow"Adapt transmitting PHY rate with receiving PHY rate from a client.
protection-modeoption
Enable/disable 802.11g protection modes to support backwards compatibility with older clients (rtscts, ctsonly, disable).
"rtscts"Enable 802.11g protection RTS/CTS mode.
"ctsonly"Enable 802.11g protection CTS only mode.
"disable"Disable 802.11g protection mode.
radio-idunsigned int32
rts-thresholdunsigned int32

"disable"Disable Captive Portal Authentication.

wireless-controller/wtp-profile/radio-3 (object)

Configuration options for radio 3.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/radio-3
Attribute ListDescriptions
airtime-fairnessoption
Enable/disable airtime fairness (default = disable).
"disable"Disable airtime fairness (ATF) support.
"enable"Enable airtime fairness (ATF) support.
amsduoption
Enable/disable 802.11n AMSDU support. AMSDU can improve performance if supported by your WiFi clients (default = enable).
"disable"Disable AMSDU support.
"enable"Enable AMSDU support.
ap-sniffer-addrmac address
MAC address to monitor.
ap-sniffer-bufsizeunsigned int32
Sniffer buffer size (1 - 32 MB, default = 16).
ap-sniffer-chanunsigned int32
Channel on which to operate the sniffer (default = 6).
ap-sniffer-ctloption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi control frame (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
ap-sniffer-dataoption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi data frame (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi data frame
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi data frame

Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management Beacon frames (default = enable).

"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
ap-sniffer-mgmt-probeoption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management probe frames (default = enable).
"disable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
arrp-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller arrp-profile (maximum 1)
Distributed Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) profile name to assign to the radio.
auto-power-highunsigned int32
The upper bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-leveloption
Enable/disable automatic power-level adjustment to prevent co-channel interference (default = enable).
"disable"Disable automatic transmit power adjustment.
"enable"Enable automatic transmit power adjustment.
auto-power-lowunsigned int32
The lower bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-targetstring
Target of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (-95 to -20, default = -70).
bandoption
WiFi band that Radio 3 operates on.
"802.11a"802.11a.
"802.11b"802.11b.
"802.11g"802.11g/b.
"802.11n"802.11n/g/b at 2.4GHz.
"802.11n-5G"802.11n/a at 5GHz.
"802.11ac"802.11ac/n/a.
"802.11g-only"802.11g.
"802.11n-only"802.11n at 2.4GHz.
"802.11n-5G-only"802.11n at 5GHz.
"802.11n,g-only"802.11n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ac,n-only"802.11ac/n.
"802.11ac-only"802.11ac.
"802.11ax-5G"802.11ax/ac/n/a at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac-only"802.11ax/ac at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac,n-only"802.11ax/ac/n at 5GHz.
"802.11ax-5G-only"802.11ax at 5GHz.
"802.11ax"802.11ax/n/g/b at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax,n-only"802.11ax/n at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax,n,g-only"802.11ax/n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax-only"802.11ax at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ac-2G"802.11ac at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax-6G"802.11ax at 6GHz.
band-5g-typeoption
WiFi 5G band type.
"5g-full"Full 5G band.
"5g-high"High 5G band.
"5g-low"Low 5G band.
bandwidth-admission-controloption
Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) bandwidth admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use. A request to join the wireless network is only allowed if the access point has enough bandwidth to support it.
"disable"Disable WMM bandwidth admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM bandwidth admission control.
bandwidth-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum bandwidth capacity allowed (1 - 600000 Kbps, default = 2000).
beacon-intervalunsigned int32
Beacon interval. The time between beacon frames in milliseconds. Actual range of beacon interval depends on the AP platform type (default = 100).
bss-colorunsigned int32
BSS color value for this 11ax radio (0 - 63, disable = 0, default = 0).
bss-color-modeoption
BSS color mode for this 11ax radio (default = auto).
"auto"Automatically select BSS color value on AP.
"static"Set BSS color value on this radio based on 'bss-color' CLI.
call-admission-controloption
Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) call admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use for VoIP calls. New VoIP calls are only accepted if there is enough bandwidth available to support them.
"disable"Disable WMM call admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM call admission control.
call-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum number of Voice over WLAN (VoWLAN) phones supported by the radio (0 - 60, default = 10).
channelstring array
Selected list of wireless radio channels.
channel-bondingoption
Channel bandwidth: 160,80, 40, or 20MHz. Channels may use both 20 and 40 by enabling coexistence.
"80MHz"80 MHz channel width.
"40MHz"40 MHz channel width.
"20MHz"20 MHz channel width.
"160MHz"160 MHz channel width.
channel-utilizationoption
Enable/disable measuring channel utilization.
"disable"Disable measuring channel utilization.
"enable"Enable measuring channel utilization.
coexistenceoption
Enable/disable allowing both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio (default = enable).
"disable"Disable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
"enable"Enable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
darrpoption
Enable/disable Distributed Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) to make sure the radio is always using the most optimal channel (default = disable).
"disable"Disable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
"enable"Enable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
drmaoption
Enable/disable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA).
"enable"Enable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA).
drma-sensitivityoption
Network Coverage Factor (NCF) percentage required to consider a radio as redundant (default = low).
"low"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 100%.
"medium"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 95%.
"high"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 90%.
dtimunsigned int32
Delivery Traffic Indication Map (DTIM) period (1 - 255, default = 1). Set higher to save battery life of WiFi client in power-save mode.
frag-thresholdunsigned int32
Maximum packet size that can be sent without fragmentation (800 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
iperf-protocoloption
Iperf test protocol (default = "UDP").
"udp"UDP.
"tcp"TCP.
iperf-server-portunsigned int32
Iperf service port number.
max-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of stations (STAs) or WiFi clients supported by the radio. Range depends on the hardware.
max-distanceunsigned int32
Maximum expected distance between the AP and clients (0 - 54000 m, default = 0).
modeoption
Mode of radio 3. Radio 3 can be disabled, configured as an access point, a rogue AP monitor, a sniffer, or a station.
"disabled"Radio 3 is disabled.
"ap"Radio 3 operates as an access point that allows WiFi clients to connect to your network.
"monitor"Radio 3 operates as a dedicated monitor. As a monitor, the radio scans for other WiFi access points and adds them to the Rogue AP monitor list.
"sniffer"Radio 3 operates as a sniffer capturing WiFi frames on air.
"sam"Radio 3 operates as a station that can connect to a neighboring AP for connectivity and health check.
power-levelunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power level as a percentage of the maximum EIRP power (0 - 100, default = 100).
power-modeoption
Set radio effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP) in dBm or by a percentage of the maximum EIRP (default = percentage). This power takes into account both radio transmit power and antenna gain. Higher power level settings may be constrained by local regulatory requirements and AP capabilities.
"dBm"Set radio EIRP power in dBm.
"percentage"Set radio EIRP power by percentage.
power-valueunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power in dBm (1 - 33, default = 27).
powersave-optimizeflags
Enable client power-saving features such as TIM, AC VO, and OBSS etc.
"tim"TIM bit for client in power save mode.
"ac-vo"Use AC VO priority to send out packets in the power save queue.
"no-obss-scan"Do not put OBSS scan IE into beacon and probe response frames.
"no-11b-rate"Do not send frame using 11b data rate.
"client-rate-follow"Adapt transmitting PHY rate with receiving PHY rate from a client.
protection-modeoption
Enable/disable 802.11g protection modes to support backwards compatibility with older clients (rtscts, ctsonly, disable).
"rtscts"Enable 802.11g protection RTS/CTS mode.
"ctsonly"Enable 802.11g protection CTS only mode.
"disable"Disable 802.11g protection mode.
radio-idunsigned int32
rts-thresholdunsigned int32
Maximum packet size for RTS transmissions, specifying the maximum size of a data packet before RTS/CTS (256 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
sam-bssidmac address
BSSID for WiFi network.
sam-captive-portaloption
Enable/disable Captive Portal Authentication (default = disable).
"disable"Disable Captive Portal Authentication.
"enable"Enable Captive Portal Authentication.
sam-cwp-failure-stringstring
Failure identification on the page after an incorrect login.
sam-cwp-match-stringstring
Identification string from the captive portal login form.
sam-cwp-passwordpassword
Password for captive portal authentication.
sam-cwp-success-stringstring
Success identification on the page after a successful login.
sam-cwp-test-urlstring
Website the client is trying to access.
sam-cwp-usernamestring
Username for captive portal authentication.
sam-passwordpassword
Passphrase for WiFi network connection.
sam-report-intvunsigned int32
SAM report interval (sec), 0 for a one-time report.
sam-security-typeoption
Select WiFi network security type (default = "wpa-personal").
"open"Open.
"wpa-personal"WPA/WPA2 personal.
"wpa-enterprise"WPA/WPA2 enterprise.
sam-serverstring
sam-server-fqdnstring
SAM test server domain name.
sam-server-ipIPv4 address
SAM test server IP address.
sam-server-typeoption
Select SAM server type (default = "IP").
"ip"IPv4 address.
"fqdn"Fully Qualified Domain Name address.
sam-ssidstring
SSID for WiFi network.
sam-testoption
Select SAM test type (default = "PING").
"ping"PING test.
"iperf"IPERF test.
sam-usernamestring
Username for WiFi network connection.
short-guard-intervaloption
Use either the short guard interval (Short GI) of 400 ns or the long guard interval (Long GI) of 800 ns.
"disable"Select the 800 ns long guard interval (Long GI).
"enable"Select the 400 ns short guard interval (Short GI).
transmit-optimizeflags
Packet transmission optimization options including power saving, aggregation limiting, retry limiting, etc. All are enabled by default.
"disable"Disable packet transmission optimization.
"power-save"Tag client as operating in power save mode if excessive transmit retries occur.
"aggr-limit"Set aggregation limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
"retry-limit"Set software retry limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
"send-bar"Limit transmission of BAR frames.
vap-alloption
Configure method for assigning SSIDs to this FortiAP (default = automatically assign tunnel SSIDs).
"tunnel"Automatically select tunnel SSIDs.
"bridge"Automatically select local-bridging SSIDs.
"manual"Manually select SSIDs.
vap1string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 1
vap2string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 2
vap3string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 3
vap4string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 4
vap5string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 5
vap6string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 6
vap7string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 7
vap8string
Virtual Access Point (VAP) for wlan ID 8
vapsdatasource, refer to wireless-controller vap, wireless-controller vap-group, or system interface
Manually selected list of Virtual Access Points (VAPs).
wids-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wids-profile (maximum 1)
Wireless Intrusion Detection System (WIDS) profile name to assign to the radio.
zero-wait-dfsoption
Enable/disable zero wait DFS on radio (default = enable).
"disable"Disable zero wait DFS
"enable"Enable zero wait DFS

 

wireless-controller/wtp-profile/radio-4 (object)

Configuration options for radio 4.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/radio-4
Attribute ListDescriptions
airtime-fairnessoption
Enable/disable airtime fairness (default = disable).
"disable"Disable airtime fairness (ATF) support.
"enable"Enable airtime fairness (ATF) support.
amsduoption
Enable/disable 802.11n AMSDU support. AMSDU can improve performance if supported by your WiFi clients (default = enable).
"disable"Disable AMSDU support.
"enable"Enable AMSDU support.
ap-sniffer-addrmac address
MAC address to monitor.
ap-sniffer-bufsizeunsigned int32
Sniffer buffer size (1 - 32 MB, default = 16).
ap-sniffer-chanunsigned int32
Channel on which to operate the sniffer (default = 6).
ap-sniffer-ctloption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi control frame (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
ap-sniffer-dataoption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi data frame (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi data frame
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi data frame
ap-sniffer-mgmt-beaconoption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management Beacon frames (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi management beacon frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management beacon frame.
ap-sniffer-mgmt-otheroption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management other frames (default = enable).
"disable"Disable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
ap-sniffer-mgmt-probeoption
Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management probe frames (default = enable).
"disable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
"enable"Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
arrp-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller arrp-profile (maximum 1)
Distributed Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) profile name to assign to the radio.
auto-power-highunsigned int32
The upper bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-leveloption
Enable/disable automatic power-level adjustment to prevent co-channel interference (default = enable).
"disable"Disable automatic transmit power adjustment.
"enable"Enable automatic transmit power adjustment.

The lower bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-targetstring
Target of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (-95 to -20, default = -70).

"802.11a"802.11a.

"802.11n,g-only"802.11n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ac,n-only"802.11ac/n.
"802.11ac-only"802.11ac.
"802.11ax-5G"802.11ax/ac/n/a at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac-only"802.11ax/ac at 5GHz.
"802.11ax,ac,n-only"802.11ax/ac/n at 5GHz.
"802.11ax-5G-only"802.11ax at 5GHz.
"802.11ax"802.11ax/n/g/b at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax,n-only"802.11ax/n at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax,n,g-only"802.11ax/n/g at 2.4GHz.
"802.11ax-only"802.11ax at 2.4GHz.

"disable"Disable WMM bandwidth admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM bandwidth admission control.

Beacon interval. The time between beacon frames in milliseconds. Actual range of beacon interval depends on the AP platform type (default = 100).

"disable"Disable WMM call admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM call admission control.

"disable"Disable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.

"enable"Enable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA).

"low"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 100%.
"medium"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 95%.
"high"Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 90%.
dtimunsigned int32
Delivery Traffic Indication Map (DTIM) period (1 - 255, default = 1). Set higher to save battery life of WiFi client in power-save mode.
frag-thresholdunsigned int32
Maximum packet size that can be sent without fragmentation (800 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).

Iperf test protocol (default = "UDP").
"udp"UDP.
"tcp"TCP.

max-clientsunsigned int32

max-distanceunsigned int32
Maximum expected distance between the AP and clients (0 - 54000 m, default = 0).
modeoption
Mode of radio 3. Radio 3 can be disabled, configured as an access point, a rogue AP monitor, a sniffer, or a station.
"disabled"Radio 3 is disabled.
"ap"Radio 3 operates as an access point that allows WiFi clients to connect to your network.
"monitor"Radio 3 operates as a dedicated monitor. As a monitor, the radio scans for other WiFi access points and adds them to the Rogue AP monitor list.
"sniffer"Radio 3 operates as a sniffer capturing WiFi frames on air.
"sam"Radio 3 operates as a station that can connect to a neighboring AP for connectivity and health check.
power-levelunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power level as a percentage of the maximum EIRP power (0 - 100, default = 100).

Set radio effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP) in dBm or by a percentage of the maximum EIRP (default = percentage). This power takes into account both radio transmit power and antenna gain. Higher power level settings may be constrained by local regulatory requirements and AP capabilities.
"dBm"Set radio EIRP power in dBm.
"percentage"Set radio EIRP power by percentage.
power-valueunsigned int32
Radio EIRP power in dBm (1 - 33, default = 27).
powersave-optimizeflags
Enable client power-saving features such as TIM, AC VO, and OBSS etc.
"tim"TIM bit for client in power save mode.
"ac-vo"Use AC VO priority to send out packets in the power save queue.
"no-obss-scan"Do not put OBSS scan IE into beacon and probe response frames.
"no-11b-rate"Do not send frame using 11b data rate.
"client-rate-follow"Adapt transmitting PHY rate with receiving PHY rate from a client.

"rtscts"Enable 802.11g protection RTS/CTS mode.
"ctsonly"Enable 802.11g protection CTS only mode.
"disable"Disable 802.11g protection mode.
radio-idunsigned int32
rts-thresholdunsigned int32
Maximum packet size for RTS transmissions, specifying the maximum size of a data packet before RTS/CTS (256 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).

BSSID for WiFi network.

"enable"Enable Captive Portal Authentication.

wireless-controller/wtp-profile/split-tunneling-acl (table)

Split tunneling ACL filter list.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/split-tunneling-acl
Object/pm/config/adom/<adom_name>/obj/wireless-controller/wtp-profile/<wtp-profile_name>/split-tunneling-acl/<split-tunneling-acl_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
dest-ipIPv4 address/mask
Destination IP and mask for the split-tunneling subnet.
idsequence, master key
ID.
